review: 독특하지만 추천하기에는 애매함 지중해 버전 파크라이 같은 느낌은 있으나..   뭔가 모르게 단순하고 싼마이 감성이 좀 있고 파쿠르가 메인인 게임인데 이동이나 도하시 파쿠르는 자연스러우나 잡고 올라갈때가 좀 엉성함. 알게 모르게 다잉라이트 2와 파크라이 시리즈의 느낌이 미세하게 남아있음. 이탈리아 감성.. 뭔가 분위기는 밝으면서도 매우 어두움. 숲과 산 지역에서 길찾기는 헬에 가까움. 겜 특성상 영어가 안되면 못찾는 루트도 존재하고 아무튼 추천하기는 좀 어려우나 키셀러 사이트에서 싸게 판매하므로 아깝다 정도는 아닌듯. 파쿠르 자체는 약간 재밌음

author: {'steamid': '76561197989425257', 'num_games_owned': 448, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1669598213}
review:
This game is absolutely fantastic !!!

+ Beautiful hand-crafted Open World with many exciting places to discover
+ Immersive First Person View (you can see your full body, important for climbing, etc.)
+ Crafting not too complex, but very useful to stay alive and keep the story going
+ Two Different Game-Modes: "Story" and "Survival"
+ Absolutely amazing graphics engine
+ Melee Combat is fun
+ Very good hit impact feeling when using Crossbow

author: {'steamid': '76561198282993369', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 2453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2453, 'last_played': 1657804329}
review:
This is a really fine game, I've had a LOT of fun with it.

Not that often can we see now a kind of a game that has everything in it that was promised, but this one does that - I came here to get some stealth, parkour and cool story, and I got all of that and a little more.

I tried to play it a few years ago, got a pirate edition of the early acces, but wasn't quite lucky to understand it and thought that it's very bad, glad that I gave it another chance.

Шановне панство, то є дуже файна гра із паркуром, стелсом та приємним сюжетом. Рекомендую спробувати.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118927887', 'num_games_owned': 409, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1659302463}
review:
Elég weird darab, egyelőre nem tudom hova tenni.
Maga a játék szép, a mechanikák jók, a story homályos kissé illetve a parkour benne kicsit "wishes dying light".


Kimaxoltam, a játék felét elhaladva már sokkal nyilvánvalóbb a story, 18 óra alatt meg lehet csinálni az összes endinget. 

Jó pofa játék, bár kissé monoton tud lenni, a végére már kissé unalmassá vált a sok parkourozás benne. De még így is képes volt olyan szinten beszippantani, hogy mindent megcsináljak benne.

10/8

author: {'steamid': '76561198317599499', 'num_games_owned': 1544, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1105, 'last_played': 1657646499}
review:
Here are some Pro´s and Con´s (Spoilers are Endgame related things):

PRO´S:
+ Pretty and Big Map, with a few secrets to discover
+ Good Jump and Run Parcours
+ Nice and simple Crafting and Inventory Mechanics 
+ Interesting Story Line
+ [spoiler] Multiple Endings [/spoiler] 

CON`S:
- easy to get lost on this big Map, and especially in the forest/mountain (might just be me :) )
- Jump and Run Parcours can sometimes be very frustrating
- Fight mechanics are okay, but not that good 
- [spoiler] Endboss has way too much Health in my Opinion [/spoiler] 

Overall a nice Survival Game.
Approximately I spend ~ 15 Hours in this game (getting all the Achievements).

P.S:
If you care about Achievements you have to play this game in English. It is a known Issue that some Achievements (mainly those who are unlocked after completing a Task) are bugged. I played in German and had problems, but after switching to English I unlocked them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198424203808', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1657573532}
review:
ITA/ENG - È una vira di mezzo tra The Forest e Tomb Raider, la protagonista non è la solita ragazza impaurita dei film o giochi horror, è coraggiosa, avventurosa, sa combattere, arrampicarsi ed è agile nella fuga. Tuttavia il gioco riesce a metterti in difficoltà anche con queste caratteristiche e capacità, perché il combattimento non è mai la scelta migliore. La storia è degna da film o giochi per adolescenti del genere Men of Medan: un gruppo di ragazzi che si caccia nei guai e come nella migliore delle tradizioni, non tutti ne usciranno vivi. Non è un gioco facile ma non è nemmeno troppo dispersivo e non capita spesso di trovarsi bloccati o senza sapere cosa fare. Consigliato se ti piace l'avventura, il genere thriller e survival.
---------------------------------------------
It is a cross between The Forest and Tomb Raider, the protagonist is not the usual girl afraid of horror films or games, she is courageous, adventurous, knows how to fight, climb and is agile in escaping. However, the game manages to get you in trouble even with these characteristics and abilities, because combat is never the best choice. The story is worthy of movies or games for teenagers of the Men of Medan genre: a group of kids who get into trouble and as in the best of traditions, not all of them will make it out alive. It is not an easy game but it is not too distracting and it is not often that you find yourself stuck or without knowing what to do. Recommended if you like adventure, thriller and survival genres.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989334886', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1086, 'last_played': 1657409382}
review: For an Indie developed game it's an actual complete game, more complete than most AAA studios are able to accomplish with 2 years worth of time and effort. Now don't get me wrong this game has its ups and downs along the way and by no means is it "Perfect" but I was able to overlook a few minor hiccups (none of which were game breaking) while playing. Now the story was interesting and it developed just as I expected it to and it gives you a sense of dread and fear while exploring and navigating the island. That fear and dread were soon replaced with a sense of power once you find an actual ranged weapon and you're able to "Pick" the enemies off with relative ease. All in all I recommend this game if you're looking for something outside your normal gaming lineup.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094432263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2472, 'last_played': 1648224617}
review:
Die Young ist einer meiner absoluten Favoriten. Es wird oft als Survival beschrieben, dabei wird hier nur rudimentär im Rucksack gecraftet. Es ist eher ein Stealth-RPG mit viel Parcours und Rätseln wie es weitergeht. Die Landschaft ist absolut gelungen und abwechslungsreich.

Keine Ahnung wie IndieGala das hingekriegt hat, Die Young ist fantastisch, alle anderen Spiele von denen sind Trash. Zum zweitenmal habe ich es nun durchgespielt und dabei wird es wohl nicht bleiben.

Wer mehr vom Spiel sehen will oder Hilfestellung beim Vorankommen braucht dem sei die YouTube Playlist von 'Wild Jester' empfohlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000313700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 813, 'playtime_forever': 791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 791, 'last_played': 1655536096}
review:
"Ja wunderbar, endlich mal ein wohlverdienter Urlaub, hach...
Aber ist ja auch mal nötig, immer nur Titanen jagen und Monster wegkloppen, ist ja auch nicht das Wahre. Macht zwar immer wieder Spaß, aber bisschen ausspannen und die Füße hochlegen tut auch mal gut.
Und diese Urlaubsinsel sieht ja auch wirklich malerisch aus.

Blöd nur, dass mir jemand gleich bei der Ankunft eine über gebraten und mich halbtot in nem ausgetrockneten Brunnen liegen lassen hat. Pfffft...

Das nenn ich aber nicht gerade gastfreundlich. Na mal gucken, wo ist mein Streitkolben?
Natürlich weg! Es war so klar, na wehe, wenn ich den Dieb erwische...
... dann...
... dann...
... dann klopp ich den weg! Aber sowas von!

Na hilft ja nix, erstmal die Kletterei aus dem Brunnen halbwegs meistern und dann die Augen wieder ans gleißende Sonnenlicht gewöhnen.
Ist immer noch echt hübsch hier, alles so hell, die Bäume, die Berge, die Gräser... schon echt urlaubsmäßig.

Aber die Freizeit muss noch kurz warten, Wer auch immer mich hier ausgeknocked hat, wird erst mal fein säuberlich in den Boden gekloppt und erst danach leg ich mich auf die faule Haut.
Nur wo soll ich anfangen?
Hm...
Vielleicht da vorne, da scheint so eine Art Tempelruine zu sein und hah! Da läuft ne Gestalt mit Kapuze und ner Riesenaxt herum. 
Den frag ich mal, ob er sich auskennt...

Huch? beim Ausfragen kaputtgekloppt...
Na hallo? Die Leutchen hier sind aber auch zerbrechlich, da muss ich ja die Samthandschühchen auspacken. Ich hab den nur ganz wenig angestupst und schon war er hin. Was ein Weichei.

Na egal, ich find schon nen neuen Einheimischen, jeder weiß, dass auf solchen Inseln immer haufenweise Eingeborene leben, die einen kochen und verspeisen wollen. Die frag ich, wenn ich sie treff und da vorne ist auch schon ein Wildtier. Ein Hund?
Nanu? Wie kommt der denn hierher?
Komm mal her, Junge. Jaahhhh, braver Kerl...

Aua!
Hey, gar nicht brav!
Beiß mich noch einmal und ich klopp Dich weg...

Hupsi... na hat ja keiner gesehen und der Hund könnte ja genauso gut an Altersschwäche gestorben sein. Ich glaub, der war auch schon ganz alt und krank...

So langsam wird das hier aber schon recht unangenehm... ich bin nicht gerade der beste Gast, alle die ich treffe, sind danach ein Häufchen Brei.
Notiz an mich selbst: Mehr aufpassen und sanfter kloppen, Jeanne.

Aber ich find schon noch jemanden, der mir den Weg erklärt, ich brauch nur meinen Streitkolben und den Dieb, dann kann mein Urlaub auch schon losgehen...

Oh da vorne, ein netter Typ mit Armbrust und Eishockeymaske... hey Du da!

KLOPP!

Öhm, naja der war sowieso schon halbtot und bestimmt auch recht gebrechlich, könnt ich mir denken. Gut dass ers jetzt hinter sich hat.Aber da vorne ist ein Tier, ein Wildschwein, wie es scheint...

KLOPP!

Ach egal, dann gibts heute eben Kotelett. Aber jetzt hab ich jemanden, da vorne ist so ne Gruselgestalt mit Kapuze und ...

KLOPP!

Ach Mist, sind die Leute hier aus Glas gemacht oder was...?
Hey, kommt mal alle her! Wer überlebt, darf mir ne Wegbeschreibung geben! Ja auch Du da hinten..."

KLOPP, KLOPP, KLOPP...

Ja, lieber Leser und so wurde die Vorgeschichte einer völlig leblosen, leer gefegten Insel geschrieben. 
Was Du natürlich nicht hinbekommst, Dir fehlt Jeanne´s bestechender Charme und ihre Klopp-Fertigkeit.

Du darfst auf der einsamen Gruselinsel voller Irrer Mörder und wilder, wilder Wildtierchen gerne um Dein Leben rennen. 
Und zwar mit tollen und echt sauschweren Hüpfeinlagen, ist das nicht toll?

Ich weiß, das hat mir das Spiel wirklich fast vergellt, dieses sinnlose Parkour Gehopse auf den Millimeter genau ist echt kaum auszuhalten. Nervt in jedem anderen Game auch und hier ists sogar ein Kernelement.

Aber beiß Dich durch, die Story ist zu spannend, das Setting zu erfrischend, hell (nicht Green Hell) und freundlich sommerlich und das restliche Gameplay zu befriedigend, um es nicht zu tun.

Bisschen Crafting, ein immervolles Inventar und leichte Kampf-Mechaniken gibts nämlich auch noch. Die Erkundung der wirklich wunderschönen Insel (Und ja, ich werd auch noch drei weitere Male erwähnen, wie umwerfend hübsch die Szenerie ist.) macht Spaß und Hunger und Durst im Zaum zu halten ist angenehm Survival fordernd und fördernd.

Und ist ja auch mal ein schicker neuer Ansatz, das blanke Überleben in einem Survival Spiel in den Vordergrund zu stellen. Blanke Ironie, dass es sonst eigentlich fast immer nur um Crafting geht, haha.

Aber hier hat Kampf selten einen Sinn, verbarrikadieren kannst Du Dich schonmal gar nicht und viel Zeit bleibt Dir auch nicht. 
Also lauf, spring, renn und stolpere in die Freiheit oder eben in den Tod. Hauptsache Du bleibst in Bewegung. Dadurch ergibt sich ein äußerst gehetztes Grundgefühl, die Panik sitzt Dir im Nacken, wenn fiese Mörderbanden Dich ins Visier genommen haben und nebenbei erzeugt das ganze auch nette Teenie-Slasher-Vibes. 

Also zieh Deine besten Laufschuhe an, gewöhn Dich gefälligst an nervige pixelgenaue Hüpfeinlagen und flieh um Dein Leben und dabei wünsch ich Dir wie immer...

... viel Spaß  ;-)




Klopper Jeanne Teil 6




Und hey, wenn´s Dir gefallen hat, ne Runde von mir zu lesen, dann klick hier
https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41622336/
und da gibts mehr von mir auf meiner Curator Seite. Schmökern for free: Also stell Dir nen Tee bereit und viel Spaß beim lesen...

author: {'steamid': '76561198003881125', 'num_games_owned': 370, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1742, 'last_played': 1655121891}
review: Это не выживание в классическом понимании, тут проще сорваться со скалы, чем помереть от жажды или отравления, не нужно постоянно мониторить уровень голода/жажды/усталости, игра не про это, игрок оказывается в песочнице, методом проб и ошибок постигает нехитрые правила, у песочницы есть начало и финал (даже три), есть сюжет, который будет вести игрока от начала и до финала, есть паркур, не сложный, но интересный, есть ближний бой, про который игрок забудет, как только получит арбалет, есть неплохая графика, которая строго не рекомендуется всем графоманам, есть отличная музыка.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082419386', 'num_games_owned': 3652, 'num_reviews': 375, 'playtime_forever': 1686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1686, 'last_played': 1654534981}
review:
Die Young is a survival FPS, where you play as a girl called Daphne, and you go to a not well known island around Turkey, with your friends, however the trip takes a dark turn and you get kidnapped and have to survive against nature and crazy islanders and leave this place at any cost.

The game looks pretty good in my opinion, especially the light and dark effects, however it's a bit un-optimzed (or maybe a 1050Ti is not enough for this game). Some of the music in the game is pretty good, adds to the action, however the game chooses the tracks randomly, sometimes even cut the tracks, which results a weird explains, but not too bad. The controls were all right, it was a bit hard to get used too, but nothing to serious. The play area is quite big, there are lot of routes to go on and secrets to find, Die Young can deliver that. You also got multiple endings for the game, too. The survival mechanisms are simple: you have to watch out for your health and to not get dehydrated, so you will have to hunt animals, loot house, make your own medicines and weapons, also use the inhabitants tools against them. This all adds a lot of fun factor to the game altogether. The mood of the game is pretty cool, at the beginning it is indeed scary to go against the human enemies and the nature, also the whole environment looks great too. Not even mentioning the parkour system, which the game has, similar to Mirror's Edge. The story was all right, it kept me interested in throughout the game.

However, the game is far from perfect. First of all, the graphics and textures can bug... a lot. Your hands clip through the wall, the enemy's ragdoll clip through basically anything, some rock textures are weird. The bigger issue with the game, it's that size... the island is big, and it's like a maze. Basically I had to play around +15 hours, because at one of the area, I had no clue where to go basically, and it was so huge, that I explored a lot of part of the map, but the most important ones, and I basically had to look up where to go. Also, playing this game a lot will make you unbothered to any enemies in the game. At the beginning, I was really cautious against anything and I managed my inventory accordingly, however around half way of my playthrough, I realized the AI's flaw and you can bug it out if you want to, and I knew what equipment I need, so I crafted only that. About the characters... it's one thing that they are unlikable, except a few minor characters, but the voice actors are pretty bad in my opinion, especially the main character's voice actor.

Die Young is a mixture of Mirror's Edge and Dying Light, which sounds good on paper, but it's a bit unstable and has some issues, but has an unique mood. In my opinion it was an all right game and I can recommend it to play it, however if you are a hardcore survival game fan, then play this game if you have nothing else to do, because you most likely not gonna enjoy it that much. 16.8€ is quite expensive for it, get it for around 7-8€.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066333378', 'num_games_owned': 784, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1075, 'last_played': 1654450235}

author: {'steamid': '76561198056818248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 2222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2222, 'last_played': 1654441728}
review:
Zu diesem Spiel entwickelte ich eine Hass-Liebe. Ich konnte einfach nicht die Finger davon lassen, da ich unbedingt wissen wollte, wie es aufhört. Aber jedesmal wenn ich das Spiel spielte, nervten mich etliche Dinge. Woraufhin ich dann irgendwann gefrustet wiedermal auf Alt-F4 drückte....

Der Spieler steuert Daphne, eine Person von mehreren, die beschlossen einen schönen Urlaub auf einer Insel zu machen. Blöd nur, dass man dann auf der Insel überfallen wird und in einem Brunnen eingesperrt wieder aufwacht.
Das Spiel nimmt einen so gut wie gar nicht an die Hand. Es gibt zwar Questbeschreibungen und diese sind zum Teil auch mit ungefähren Ortsangaben versehen, aber dorthin zu gelangen ist jedesmal eine Herausforderung. Es gibt nämlich nie einen geraden Weg und man muss sich seinen Weg suchen. Es ist zum Teil ziemlich labyrinthartig... Die Karte zeigt immer nur die aktuelle Umgebung an, nicht die gesamte Insel auf einmal, was die Navigation zusätzlich noch erschwert. Dazu das begrenze Inventar, was man nur allmählich etwas aufstocken kann (dass man mehr Platz hat). Alles etwas schleppend... Man kann einige Dinge craften, aber - zumindest zu beginn - fehlt einem meistens noch die eine oder andere Zutat, um den Craftvorgang durchführen zu können. Später ist das nicht mehr so dramatisch, da man bis dahin viel Rohstoffe gefunden hat. Da gibt's dann höchstens das Problem, dass man wieder nicht die richtigen Zutaten im Inventar hat, weil, das habe ich jedenfalls so gemacht, man die Zutaten in sein Lager gepackt hat, da das Inventar dennoch begrenzt ist, während das Lager unendlichen Fassungsraum bietet.
Die Lager sind auf der ganzen Insel verteilt, in grossen Abständen und dienen ausserdem als Schnellreisestationen und Übernachtungsmöglichkeit.

Eines darf einen nicht entmutigen: Die Dinge, die man suchen muss, um weiterzukommen. Beispielsweise ein Schlüssel für eine Tür. Ich stehe also am einen Ende der Insel, benötige einen Schlüssel für eine Tür und dieser befindet sich dann ganz am anderen Ende der Insel. Immens weit weg, wie man es von den sonst üblichen Spielen absolut nicht gewöhnt ist.

Was mich zum Frusten brachte, sind logische Fehler im Spiel. Z.B. ist eine Gittertür ohne Vorhängeschloss oder sonstiger Verriegelungsmöglichkeit im Spiel abgeschlossen - dabei ist die Tür grafisch nicht abgeschlossen! Sowas nervt einfach.
Oder man steht vor einer verschlossenen Tür und will sie öffnen: "Von der anderen Seite verschlossen", heisst es dann. Und das selbe heisst es dann wieder, wenn man auf der anderen Seite steht.... Ahja.....
Oder Türen, bei denen es heisst, sie seien verschlossen oder blockiert (steckt fest). Von der anderen Seite kann man die Tür dann öffnen - ohne Schlüssel oder ohne Barrikaden wegräumen zu müssen.

Das war nur ein Beispiel, so gibt's noch etliche logische Fehler mehr....

Dann die deutsche Version! Wer hat das bloss übersetzt? Da sind so richtige Schnitzer drin in der deutschen Fassung. Z. B. tötet man ein Tier, da man dessen Fell zum Craften benötigt. Nimmt man das Fell auf, zeigt das Spiel an: "Verstecken aufgenommnen". Is klar, "verstecken"...Weil Pelz = Hide. Was sonst.... Oh mann...
Auch dies ist nur ein Beispiel von vielen, die mich anfangs extrem verwirrten.

Naja, schliesslich habe ich es dann doch noch durchgespielt, trotz der Grafikfehler, logischen Denkfehlern, Bugs und vielen Frustmomenten. Im Nachhinein war ich ganz froh, dass ich es nun endlich durchgezockt hatte. Endlich konnte ich es wieder von meiner Festplatte entfernen. Hallelujah xD

author: {'steamid': '76561198011415117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1377, 'last_played': 1654379833}
review:
Die young propose une expérience survival sympathique teintée de parkour plutôt bien fichu. Avec un scénario digne d'un bon film de série z. Ça ne vole pas très haut mais on a envie de savoir la fin. Les environnements méditerranéen sont visuellement bien retranscrits et la faune est omniprésente (trop ?). 

Je ne regrette qu'une chose l'[b]impossibilité de débloquer certains succès[/b] à cause d'un bug alors que les critères sont bien remplis. Malgré de multiples tentatives, rien n'y fait. Frustrant.
Si la possibilité était offerte, j'aurais mis une note moyenne.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084021881', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1343, 'last_played': 1654221314}
review:
Surprisingly good if you went in with low expectations.
All the different places you could explore on this mystery horror island and the story that comes with it was really fun to progress through. It felt very similar to the forest but plays very differently.
The enemies in this game do not respawn which kinda sucks but at the same time, is not bad in this game. This along with the equipment progression really feeds into a power fantasy, for example, [spoiler]when you clear out the military base[/spoiler] as Daphne, a girl not at all in her element. Killing a bunch of bad guys as an untrained and lost girl kinda funny. 
The boss fights are doodoo balls though, as two of them share the same unvaried moveset. That doesn't take away from the game too much however because the bosses are a minimal part of the game experience.

Overall really fun for $20, better if on sale. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198110451233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1652978659}
review: Example of how game design can go horrible. Its a product of a confused mind who thought tossing a little bit from other games into a pot and stirring it will be a good idea. The end result a character running in a big empty space occasionally catching a fight here and there and rest is jumping puzzles which are lengthy and boring. Many invisible collision boxes here and there that keeps pushing you down so you have to repeat a boring jump puzzle. Its quite linear game and there is nothing interesting to the story. Gameplay is so numb it feels like a walking simulator. Conclusion, waste of time and resources by an unsuccessful game designer. With all this effort they could have come up with a proper game. Waste of 20gb space on your hard drvie.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012774912', 'num_games_owned': 1312, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1652869882}
review:
Может я так стар или избалован играми, но я не могу играть в игру которая выбрасывает тебя на локацию и говорит "делай что-нибудь" а куда идти? "куда-нибудь" Квесты есть но они как список задачь, найди то-то, то-то, починить то и то, убей того и того! Зачем? Почему? И как я должен знать что это и где это? Игра не ведёт тебя, не вводит в курс происходящего, даже фаркраи (прости господь за упоминание юби) перед тем как дать тебе свободу ставили перед тобой цели и ты мог выполнять её или забить на неё, но основной кур был задан всегда. А тут персонаж говорит "мне надо выбраться" ВСЁ! Я не смог в это играть пол часа побегал, по исследовал и на этом всё. 
Боёвка тут аля наносишь удар, твой персонаж получает растяжение мышц. Иначе я не могу объяснить что после каждого сильного удара перс отходит от него секунды 3, ты не можешь бить или ходить после атаки, текстуры периодически появляются на ходу, сначала мыло, а потом бац и вроди неплохая картинка. К противнику можно подкрасться сзади, но атаковать его скрытной атакой или какой-нибудь критической нельзя, надо встать, замахнуться и ударить. В общем я не понял что за игра такая.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970971313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1652216880}
review:
Plays like a weird mix of Tomb Raider and a walking simulator, but with appalling controls.
You'll repeatedly miss the handhold you're jumping for, fall a few metres, and have to clamber around to get back to where you were to try again.

The landscape seems to be mostly populated by small animals and occasional characters just running in place.

Some areas feature locked doors which you'll need to find a way around, but instead of being able to unlock them from the far side, you eventually find keys when you've just about cleared the whole area, at which point they're useless.
This, combined with only being allowed save in certain locations, and repeated damage from random falls, really smacks of a game of limited length trying to drag it out by wasting the player's time.

Feels like it could have been a lot better than it is, but there's nothing particularly interesting that makes it worth the drag.

this game is unbearable to play. the map in the game is a fucking static image that only changes when you move past the square. you have no sense of where to go. your legit thrown into a island with a jpeg and told find some coastal tower in the middle of the alps and btw theres homicidal maniacs after you and dogs who fucking team up on you. crafting in this game is dog shite aswell because you get no fucking instruction on how to get the resources. and the places where you can get the resources are surrounded by enemies who can 2 shot you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066417798', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2292, 'last_played': 1667953104}
review:
Me surpreendeu!
Na primeira meia hora de jogo eu não achei muito interessante, mas conforme explorava foi melhorando. Eu tinha certeza que depois de abrir a porta que precisa da chave de touro eu teria um caminho linear até chegar a High Tower, mas fui surpreendido com a quantidade de cenários e estruturas que tinha na nova área.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999000679', 'num_games_owned': 5439, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1016, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1016, 'last_played': 1651396110}
review:
tl;dr This game was frustratingly almost great. It repeatedly jumped between 6/10 and 9/10 for me. I got all the achievements which I usually don't do (only needed miss the deadline and kill the liar after finishing the game without trying to get any)

Far Cry/Dead Island with (although an actually linear because of quest requirements) open world
I actually preferred the prologue over the rest of the game because I liked it better when it was a more action focused game then hiding and avoiding and backtracking and getting lost

and here I exclusively rant:
I played on the adventure mode and with the option to tone down the survival elements that is in the menu.
To try to avoid having the game annoy me with dieing over and over. Which I'm glad I did because there was already enough running around backtracking to annoy me. There are many fast travel points in the game, that you have to find and are sometimes right in front of your face and other time hidden behind something or in a place you wouldn't have expected. I missed several paths and got to a big section I couldn't advance from for some time, that I didn't know I couldn't, because I had taken the right side path instead of the left (Damn you High Tower) I missed the pack that lets you hold more things because I didn't see it on a table. There's a prisoner you can unlock the door of near the beginning that you have to go back to after getting a particular key, but as far as I could tell the closest fast travel point was pretty far away and hard to get back to to go back to the part of the game you were now at. *sigh*

author: {'steamid': '76561197977088954', 'num_games_owned': 685, 'num_reviews': 228, 'playtime_forever': 939, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 939, 'last_played': 1663114611}
review:
Es un Must Have.
Me ha sorprendido mucho este juego. No me esperaba que me gustase tanto.

-Graficos: muy trabajados, han tenido en cuenta muchos detalles y la ambientación para ser un mundo abierto es de 10 porque no da la sensación de vacio como en muchos otros juegos con espacios grandes.
Puedes pararte a disfrutar del paisaje porque vale la pena.

-Jugabilidad: La mezcla de parkour y FPS me ha recordado mucho al Diying Light. Los controles son faciles y no te aburres.

-Enemigos: Bueno en algo tenia que fallar el juego, los enemigos en si estan bien, pero su IA... le puedes meter un flechazo en la cabeza, te mueves agachado 3 metros y ya no te detecta y se olvida de ti. Son muy simples y no suponen ningun reto cuando llevas muchos virotes para tu ballesta.

-Historia: Esta bien, es el tipico grupito de americanos que se meten donde no deben y la chica heroina tiene que escapar de la isla dominada por una secta. Sencilla, pero funciona.

Lo recomiendo totalmente. Es un buen juego que te entretendrá algunas horas.

PD: Si miras hacia abajo puedes ver tus pechitos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006590187', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 1092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1092, 'last_played': 1649277105}
review:
Die Young, el juego que predice tu embolia.

Sos una pende-ja que se escapa de parranda con los amigos a una isla donde son capturados por unos granjeros trastornados que los quieren despellejar vivos. Luego de escapar de un pozo donde la tiraron como si fuera una bolsa de bosta, tenes que empezar a movilizarte por el mapa en busca de tus amigos, pistas de que joraca esta pasando en dicha isla y objetos para sobrevivir como herramientas, armas y alimentos. 

El juego se basa mayormente en la exploracion y la supervivencia, el crafteo esta presente mas que nada para crear municiones y mejorar la capacidad de almacenamiento de nuestro inventario. Tenes que recorrer la isla buscando la manera de escapar y para ello vamos a utilizar una especie de sistema de parkout donde si le erraste, la mayoria de las veces te vas a hacer concha contra el piso y vas a tener que rehacer la ultima media hora de nuevo.

Visualmente es muy agradable y la jugabilidad es bastante buena a decir verdad, pero se vuelve algo monotono luego de un par de horas ya que basicamente es trepar paredes y evitar enemigos. Al menos hasta que conseguis la ballesta y ahi podes romperle el or-to a todo el mundo.

Normalmente recomendaria un juego como este, pero lamentablemente llegue a un punto donde me fue imposible avanzar. A cada pu-ta accion que hacia se me crasheaba el juego. Lograba alcanzar objetivos tras realizar un salto muy preciso y me tira el hijo de remil pu-ta mensaje avisandome que habia ocurrido un error y que podia enviar mi reporte. De que reporte me hablas la reconcha de tu madre!!!?... el juego salio cuando nacio Jesus... como me van a venir a decir que todavia tiene esos bugs asquerosos que te arruinan la experiencia completamente.

Me dio tanta bronca que lo desinstale, una lastima porque me hubiera gustado saber como terminaba las aventuras de la gua-cha.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127631916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 978, 'last_played': 1649152332}
review: I like games that are rough around the edges and this game is very much that. Main complaint is the controls are stiff, when you swing your weapon you can't really back out of it and gotta commit to the swing. You might wonder why this is a bad thing. Against most enemies this isn't too big of an issue because you both dodge and go in for swings. This is a problem when facing bosses though, since they don't stagger when you hit them. it's kinda like hitting a bag of potatoes. The bosses just stiffly swing at you and can sometimes trap you in a hitstun loop if the AI is feelings aggressive. For the most part the AI is either so dumb that hiding behind a rock will cause them to be confused and lose sight of you or they're super clairvoyant and will snipe you across the map. All in all, it was an alright game but that final boss made me not wanna give it another go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076678849', 'num_games_owned': 2509, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1482, 'last_played': 1648492535}
review: Jogo indie muito bom, com boa historia, e gráfico, tem os seus bugs, mas é um jogo de horror e survival  cativante que nos prende a jogar até ao final e testar os finais alternativos. Finalizei o jogo em cerca de 12 horas, mapa muito grande muito que explorar e alguma missoes secundárias que podemos fazer e apanhar colecionaveis. Nao joguei o prologue mas aguardo que saia um novo jogo, pelo final que deixaram em suspense que iam voltar a fazer o mesmo mas ainda pior em outra ilha. Recomento bastante este jogo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967346265', 'num_games_owned': 627, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1648087753}
review: This was somewhat promising at first, but I couldn't bring myself to even reach the half-way point. The game provides an interesting enough premise, a pretty cool environment, and I personally found the parkour fun. I could deal with the weird switching of music tracks, the floating objects, and odd wildlife animations. However, as I kept playing, I just felt those things just kept pulling me out of the immersion. Then I discovered how painfully stupid the AI was and I felt absolutely zero fear towards them once I could craft knives, and especially once I got the crossbow that I could one shot them with. The worst part though was being able to cheese them. I could easily take out 2 enemies at once with a baton or knife and all enemies by just throwing rocks if it was one on one - hell, I could've even taken out the executioner with stones if I was bored enough once I discovered I could kite him and get him stuck in a doorway. If you want a "helpless protagonist" game I'd suggest Alien Isolation or Outlast - while those aren't perfect they're definitely much, much better executed than this. I don't think I paid much for this, but even if it was free I can't recommend it unless you've run out of other open world games with a semi-weak protagonist and some crafting elements and don't mind poor AI. Sorry, IndieGala - I've bought a few games from you, but if you're going to develop a game yourself then you really, really need to work on your polish. This could've been a good game but you completely lost me at the [spoiler]Cujo boss fight[/spoiler]. It was laughably bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045584798', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 662, 'last_played': 1647353061}
review:
冷门但好玩，中文问题暂不做评价，单游戏质量绝对对得起这个价，跑酷+战斗的组合让人想起消逝的光芒。问题就是，在一个跑酷占大比的游戏里，主角的抗摔能力堪比杰洛特，跑到兴头之时一个小坡就能要了你的命。
作为一个开放世界游戏，地图很大，藏了很多支线和各种小故事，到处跑做任务看别人在岛上的遭遇这段是我最享受的部分，部分区域分上下两层堪比迷宫，传送点说实话有点少，而且位置都挺偏，再加上一些任务提示需要你自己看收集到的笔记，经常一个地方跑几回非常浪费时间。游戏内的时间我怀疑是和真实时间同步的，我玩到通关游戏内时间真就只完整过了两天。
战斗一般般吧，这个游戏里打架收益不高，而且近战敌人一个个都跟街舞大师似的动作花里胡哨，远程敌人都是大力士一掌就能推飞主角三米远，主角又是个莎王一个敌人刮半天，拿到弩和燃烧瓶之后就轻松了。
剧情我也看得云里雾里，不知道这个一号老大哥咋想的一点好处不给还让全岛人追杀我，最后还想让我加入他们。
缺点不少，但至少吸引我我到打通关了，能让我不半路弃坑的我就推荐6.5/10。

author: {'steamid': '76561198123208780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1176, 'last_played': 1647331996}
review:
If Farcry, dying light and the forest and mirror's edge had a love child, that would be die young.


I was playing on easy difficulty, to be honest after getting a crosbow and molotovs, the fights were mostly easy. 
Still the game can be a bit challenging with the puzzles and the parkour elements, and with fights aswell sometimes.

Overall I would say it's not that hard game, you can have a lot of fun, its a decently long open world survival/crafting/horror/parkour game, with elements.
Reminds me a lot to farcry3.
Haven't really seen any bugs or glitches. (maybe the AI is a bit dumb...)
I deffinietely recommend the game especially on sale!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045754600', 'num_games_owned': 1319, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1646776531}
review:
Way too much back and forth across a large map without any direction at all. Early in the game there is a quest that tells you to find a Bull Key and it "might be around here somewhere". This is a blatant lie designed to trick the player into wasting time. The key is actually miles away near where you start the game, so you have to backtrack essentially reverting any progress you have made so far. Not only that, but to get the key, you need to get a poison recipe (which the mission doesn't explain how or where) and a different key that is miles in the opposite direction. This is artificial padding at its worst and I have no intention of running around for hours aimlessly hoping to find random quests that are miles apart that are meant to lead to more quests that finally lead to the solution of one step in the main quest. Bare in mind that none of this is explained and is almost directly contradicted by mission explanations, implying tot he player that looking around in the area will resolve their issue. Really the only way to play this game is to explore everything immediately and ignore the main quest because it is literally impossible without randomly finding everything else.

Awful mission design, Horrible pacing, and mediocre everything else. Not worth your time at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984079948', 'num_games_owned': 1563, 'num_reviews': 436, 'playtime_forever': 1344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1344, 'last_played': 1646557392}
review: Hát mikor annak idején elkezdtem játszani és az első pályarészt láttam csak, a sziklás ösvények, a mezők, egészen a kapuig... azt hittem kb ennyi lesz a pálya. Hát tévedtem. Igaz hogy annak idején elakadtam a kulcs megszerzésével. Most sikerült tovább jutni és utána még hatalmas pálya vár ránk, égig érő megmászni való hegységgel! Elég egyedi hangulata van a játéknak. Talán a harcrendszere kicsit nehézkes, de az, hogy nem orrba szájba lövöldözni kell, az teljesen jó ütemet ad az egésznek. Grafikailag, pályatervezésileg és zeneileg is nagyon jó a játék! Igazából csak a nagyon kusza labirintusnak látszó hegyi ösvények okoztak egy kis frusztrációt, de azon kívül remek játék, remek hangulattal és gondolatokkal! Aki még nem ismeri, annak ajánlani tudom. Egy Farcry/Dying Light típusú játék, lőfegyverek, autók és zombik nélkül! Ráadásul teljesen magyar, többnyire még jól is van fordítva, de látszik, hogy nem magyar kézből származik a szöveg, mert vannak benne buta hibák, főleg az inventory tárgyaknál fordult elő néha. Ezt leszámítva sokat tesz hozzá a magyar felirat is!

author: {'steamid': '76561198408190755', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 1846, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1846, 'last_played': 1644890401}

author: {'steamid': '76561198059361840', 'num_games_owned': 1182, 'num_reviews': 1031, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1645712703}
review:
Die Young disappointed me a lot. The game itself could be really good, but it just doesn't feel that way. I would describe Die Young as the ugly child of Dying Light and Far Cry. Stranded on an island, you fight for survival and must progress as sneaky and stealthy as possible. It's a mix of parkour and survival. Unfortunately, the game feels like a walking simulator most of the time, as you just walk from A to B a lot (go to A and find out that you need keys, go to B to get the keys, go back to A, open the lock, gather new items, go to C, etc.) - at least in the first half of the game. The second half is more about climbing a lot. Nevertheless, there is not much happening, and you have seen 70% of all the interesting locations in the first hour (you will unblock new areas as you keep playing – but a big part of the late game consists of walking through the woods, climbing a mountain and reaching the top of the high tower). Angry animals are slow and can be outrun and the enemies can’t really catch up either, if you jump on rocks in order to escape.

The worst thing about the game is that sometimes you go down a huge route, which was sometimes even difficult to reach, only to realise that you are at a dead end because you need another key or another special item to move on. So, you turn back the whole way again to get the item and come back. And this happens way too often. Especially because there is no clear indication of where to go, but most of the paths are blocked until you have the right objects. Super annoying and a big waste of time.

Unfortunately, even the gameplay doesn't feel as good as I wish it did. In fact, the controls are slightly junky when running around and climbing. Also, the fighting doesn't really feel that great for being a main element of the game. The parkour elements themselves are nicely done, even if there are minor technical errors from time to time.

The story is okay, but not exceptional (and it only begins to be interesting towards the end of the game). The graphics, on the other hand, are really well done.

Unfortunately, I can only recommend the game when it's strongly on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198315877536', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 1230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1230, 'last_played': 1645262027}
review:
[h1]101 Далматинец или во что я играю[/h1]
Что будет если смешать все жанры в одно и переделывать игру?вот пример.
[h1]Геймплей[/h1]Бегаешь по полю, по горам по лесам и что-то открываешь, я просто не могу даже понять во что я играю, об этом ниже, основная концепция игры отсутствует, то есть тут нет нечего за что можно зацепиться как фактор относящийся к геймплею игры.Кроме беголок от собак и походов туда куда гласит журнал, сюда же можно отнести паркур, немного лутания и обследования локаций.
[h1]Сюжет[/h1]Мы на острове, что мы тут делаем я не понял так как эта часть не переведена"точнее переведена Куплиновом, но зная его мастерский перевод", во всём остальном мы должны просто выбраться от сюда, опять же из-за проблем в геймплее я не знаю как он должен подаваться, я не понимаю про что эта игра, эта сюжетная игра?или сюжетка с выживанием?или шутер в открытом мире по типу фар край?но тут нет чего из этих жанров, и как оценивать сюжет я не знаю, как для выживалки не плохо, но это не выживалка, об этом ниже, и это не фар край для которого это был бы просто ужасный сюжет, считайте что в этой игре нет сюжета так как его повествование тоже нет.
Сюжет подаётся исключительно записками, не относятся к сюжету, а к истории острова, кто такая главная девица я не узнал, как и не узнал про её друзей и вообще чего-либо личного, единственное, что понял так это историю острова, их планы и зарождения всего происходящего.
[h1]Открытый мир[/h1]Eго здесь нет, тут есть локации, которые не обязательные к исследованию, это не открытый мир, кроме травы и собак в нём нечего нет, просто пространство, по которому бегает игрок, чтобы пройти игру.
[h1]Отдельные части игры и другое[/h1]-Главный мой вопрос это во что я играю? Игра как выживания не существует, единственное из выживания тут возможность пить, но воды тут столько что потребности в ней вообще нет,по поводу крафта эта обычный крафт аптечки и ножей всё, то есть обычный крафт для любой игры в виде фар край, если брать эту игру как шутер в открытом мире, то уж простите, но это вообще не шутер, заданий тут нет даже сюжетных, задания которая показывает игра были бы нормальные для игры в виде выживания,но выживания тут нет, да и самого открытого мира нет, это поле затыканное постройками для изучения.Так вот эта первая игра в которой я не смог понять тему и идею игры, мне кажется разработчики натыкали сюда всё что можно, и после того как они сделали эту кашу игра превратилось вот в это, непонятное месиво из всего, хоть кто-нибудь доведёт до меня информацию для чего они сделали потребность в воде?чтобы сказать всём что это выживания?Тут есть даже элементы хоррора! и довольно страшные, во что я играю!?
- Боссы большая собака, чем она отличается от других псин которым я пробивал череп гарпуном я не знаю, но по этой собаке не проходит урон не от чего кроме электричества.Босс из пролога, дебильная имба, с е******* камнем в руках и собак не забыли, файт с боссом держится на багах по которым он не может тебя достать, это не файт с боссом. Финальный босс точно такой же, большая кукла и много собак и людей, босс побеждается по той же тактики, сначала расстрел всех псин, потом глупая долбёжка босса из места где он тебя не достанет и камней ему тоже дать не забыли.Это может быть описано сложно, но это совсем не так, сам босс вообще не какой, достаточно запастись молотова, чтобы убить других нпс, после чего босс становится толстяком с камнем в руках.Вот такой босс, радуетесь это финал.
- Стелс, Кто-то в обзорах писал что ему, понравился стелс, СТЕЛС? Это то что можно спрятаться в кусты и тебя не видно, во всём остальном его нет, нпс на столько тупые что если видят труп то просто подходят к нему и ждут следующею стрелу в лоб, если вообще видят, многие стоят как тупени и смотрят в одну точку друг за другом, как вы можете понять в стелс я тут не играл, его здесь нет.
- Паркур, основная тема игры, сделано ужасно, всегда когда прыгаешь, опасаешься что она не схватится, были такие случаи когда она не цеплялась за отступ несколько раз подряд, ты даже начинаешь сомневаться что тебе туда, но нет она просто не схватилась.
- Концовки(без спойлеров),1 концовка с принятием общины, интересно то что эту концовку можно получить не проходя 3 локацию игры, то есть она самая быстрая в игре и чтобы получить настоящею концовку с побегом, нужно найти эту 3 локацию, до тех пор пока ты её не нашёл, задание не появится, а в основном будет задания с убийством друга, её выполнения не влияет на другие концовки, но открывает короткую, и игрок не знающий о других концовках сделает что? Верно побежит туда куда сказала игра и закончит игру даже не знаю что получил самую короткую концовку.
- Кат-Сцена в начале, просто нет субтитров и текста только звук, посмотрел эту игру в 2017 году, та же самая заставка, но всё есть, куда пропало?
- Пролог, вообще не чего не понятно, в финале тупой сложный босс, ну и нечего не переведено, поэтому я так и не понял финал этого пролога, каким образом он рассказывает предысторию, а главное историю вообще чего?для чего он вообще нужен?неясно.
+ Достижения, я смог получить все, особо не напрягаясь, но для того чтобы их получить нужно сбрасывать прогресс и сохраняться в слоты почаще, так как некоторые элементы по ходу игры становятся невозможны, например убив 1 мини босса, другой босс исчезает, если вы хотите все достижения, заранее найдите источники по прохождению.
[h1] Брать?[/h1]
Я сомневаюсь ответить, по факту игра не какая, и нечего интересного не предоставляет, но что-то в ней есть - есть мысль хорошей игры, если бы они направили её в одну сторону, но поставить положительный отзыв после уведённой каши я не могу, да игра не плохая и я бы сказал что она мне больше понравилась чем не понравилась, но я не очень люблю кашу без сахара.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030401927', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2430, 'last_played': 1644668145}
review:
Играла ещё в неё когда была альфа, сюжета особого не было, спустя года дошли руки пройти её, ох.... Знала бы я раньше, что столько всего сделали прошла бы намного раньше.
Сюжет есть и достаточно хороший, жаль что все запутанно и ты не понимаешь сначала куда тебе и зачем, но спустя время ты начинаешь понимать игру, тогда-то все и начинается)) Прошла практически за сутки, играла весь день и не могла оторваться, было очень интересно, а что же дальше? 
Приятно, что есть разные концовки и нпс. 
Я считаю, что игрулька хорошая, жаль второй части нету.

review: excellente surprise! que d'énigmes et de chemins possibles, les phases d'escalades tres prenantes, les labyrinthes supers, le craft... et j'en passe. petit bémol pour la vie dans le jeu qui est un peu trop vide et le boss pas tres intelligent. mais dans l'ensemble, une belle surprise. 16/20 pas moins.

author: {'steamid': '76561198974471430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1425, 'last_played': 1643835952}
review:
I really enjoyed Die Young, which is all I want from a game. Just keep in mind that it is an indie game and it has that indie "jank" (bad AI, at best mediocre voice acting etc.). But... the puzzles and parkour is interesting, the island is beautiful and fun to explore. This is basically an open world adventure game with some light survival elements and personally I like it that way.

Oh and yeah... just like everyone else said, the end boss fight is..bad. You are basically forced into a fight. But that is literally 0.1% of the game.

Fun factor: 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197982696065', 'num_games_owned': 929, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2496, 'last_played': 1644123866}
review:
Pretty good "survival horror/parkour" game.

With slow, very-completionist play, I 100%-ed it in 41 hours: a decent amount of entertainment for the money, I feel. All achievements can be gained, mostly just by reaching places through the course of the story, and completing necessary quests. The remainder are completed through normal completionist play (killing optional people, etc). Zero silly or grindy achievements, so even better than the prologue. If you complete the main quest, all sidequests, and kill all bosses, you should 100% the game.

I believe one of the goals in making the game was to make it dissimilar to many survival games (The Forest, Subnautica, etc) in that it is not a base-builder, but instead pushes you to progress through the goals of the story. I'd say it by-and-large achieved that goal. One of their tactics was to have it so that the closest you have to a "base" is the system of fast-travel nodes, which also have an infinite storage "bank" at them, shared between all fast-travel points. So there's no reason to return to areas you've cleared out, and instead you want to move forward to find more loot.

For a slow completionist explorer gameplay, the game is very easy, at least in "adventure" mode (medium difficulty, if you change it in the settings later). You have more food, weapons, meds and tools than you will ever need. The only thing you will realistically find yourself wanting more of is materials for expanding your craft bag, most notably the "binding" material; and wanting to find more snakes! For the most part, though, it's one of those games where, if you want to save, you'll find materials to build a camp fire, or a pre-built one; if you need to crowbar something open, one will usually be conveniently to hand, etc. Not *always*, though, so it's worth carrying all your tools (or at least, materials to build them with) at all times.

Survival mode (the harder setting) is apparently tougher, and you have pretty fine-grained control over the difficulty, being able to tweak 

Pleasantly PC-oriented controls, so things like the scroll-wheel work in containers, etc.

The parcour/climbing part of the game feels a little simplistic, as you can only climb on deliberately placed handholds, not on arbitrary rock surfaces. Still, the mechanics are fun and challenging. The timing for the parkour jumping feels "off" somehow, in that the latest time you can jump is when your body is already over the edge of the thing you're jumping off: the moment your leg would be fully extended behind you, rather than the moment you would send the "jump" message to your leg. Despite this minor niggle, it's still mostly pretty easy and fun, and this different timing means most jumps are far more lenient with my slow reflexes than I have any right to expect. Basically, it's tuned to make the player feel like they are being awesome, and I like that: that's what good game design does.

Props to the game designers throughout, really. The game design of the climbing puzzles, and all challenges in general, is good. A *lot* of thought has clearly gone into the layout of the areas, giving good vistas and letting you plan your approach through areas ahead of time by letting you look over them, while concealing from you things that they wanted to reveal later.

Finding stuff can be a pain sometimes, I had to look a few things up, but the full detailed map in the Steam community's "guides" section will help with that.

Negligible replay value: I don't see myself ever returning to the game, but it was a worthwhile experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078978847', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 2974, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2974, 'last_played': 1643522177}
review:
[h1]Добежать до свободы...[/h1]

Отличный эксплоринг большого и красивого острова от первого лица с элементами паркура по типу Mirror's Edge, боями со злюками по типу Dying Light и лутанием труднодоступных мест по типу радиовышек из Far Cry 3.

[h1]Впечатления[/h1]
Удивительно красивые локации, от красочных полей до извилистых расщелин, в UHD выглядят просто великолепно ([url=steamcommunity.com/id/Alekhly/screenshots/?appid=433170]см. мои скриншоты[/url]). Порой кажется, что [b]главный герой это сам остров[/b], столько событий ему пришлось повидать. Ты ходишь по следам этих событий, тебе хочется излазать каждый уголок, везде есть какие-нибудь интересности, хочется пройти все побочки. А пролить свет на происходящее может как маленькая старая записка, так и сами локации, которые помнят всё, что происходило на острове. Любой полуразрушенный дом рассказывает историю, вызывая [b]чувства из детства, когда ты шарился по заброшкам[/b]. Музыка с колокольчиками, пиццикато и контрабасом шикарная, прямиком из ретро хорроров.

[h1]Сюжет[/h1]
На старте тебе кажется что нужно просто спастись из плена неких сектантов, делов-то! По началу ты прячешься в кустах и шарахаешься от каждого шороха, параллельно изучая остров. Постепенно ты набираешься опыта и начинаешь досаждать островитянам, а также понимаешь что это не такие уж простые сектанты. Под конец, окончательно осмелев, ты из пленника становишься [b]занозой в заднице "сектантов"[/b] и смело рыпаешься на боссов. А сюжет тем временем выдает твисты. Разработчики даже не поленились сделать годный пролог-приквел отдельной игрой, рекомендую ознакомиться.

[h1]Геймплей[/h1]
Игра грамотно разделена на три условных этапа. Сначала ты бегаешь по полям и прячешься в кустах, привыкая к механикам. На втором этапе тебе подкидывают всё больше врагов и начинается дикий симулятор скалолаза, если раньше ты не боялся высоты, то теперь будешь бояться, потому что от всех этих выкрутасов на скалах [b]одно место сжимается в сингулярность[/b]. На третьем этапе тебя кидают практически в самое пекло, где хватает и врагов, и прыжко-беготни.

[h1]Советы[/h1]
Рекомендую почаще поглядывать в журнал, по началу не очевидно что там можно выбирать активный квест и на карте появится метка. Рекомендую играть только на максимальном уровне сложности, убивать врагов не трудно, лута в игре в избытке. Иначе крафт вообще становится бесполезным, [strike]столовая[/strike] бурдюк и прочие аксессуары становятся бесполезными, инвентарь забьётся под завязку уже к середине игры.

[h1]Плюсы[/h1]
[b]Драйвовый геймплей, лайтовый крафт[/b]
[b]Красивые локации с нарративом через левелдизайн[/b]
[b]Умеренно длинная и интересная история, достойная продолжения[/b]

[h1]Минусы[/h1]
Несбалансированные уровни сложности
Топорная анимация врагов и живности
Кривая локализация (восприятию не мешает)
Низкокачественные облака портят общую картинку

author: {'steamid': '76561198022527186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 2682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2682, 'last_played': 1643564473}
review:
[h1]Hoofit dies young[/h1]

[b]What is Die Young[/b]
It’s a survival game in the literal sense of the world. You play a young woman called Daphne who is stuck on an island and is attempting to find her friends and escape. As beautiful as the island is, it is full of dangerous wildlife, and people that wish to seek you harm. You will need to eat, keep hydrated and sleep, failing to do the last two will kill you. As well as finding and making weapons, handy equipment and maybe even finding some of the very rare wearable items that are ‘hidden’ across the island. There is definite item resource management going on.

I’ve seen it described as a survival horror and I can see why, there are some unpleasant people/things that go on, but it’s not like resident evil where its constant, or that’s a part of the game’s soul. Most of the island is pretty and there’s even friendly villagers, there’s even large parts of it where you can just relax. Whilst there are bad things, there’s only really a couple of places, later on where horrifying things have happened/are happening.

I would call it survival exploration, the exploration of which involves a lot of parkouring- jumping on/off things climbing etc. There are a lot of places to visit, landmarks to visit and locations to explore. And yeah, you do a LOT of climbing and jumping, most of which involve some level of risk including falling to your doom. One tip learnt from experience, jump about a second after you think you should- as there’s a bit of leeway and it helps to make those tricker jumps!



[b]Die Young as a ‘true’ open world[/b]
You have total freedom to explore in that whilst you have to rest at night, you can take as much time as you want, in the main, exploring that ruin, finding out what has been happening in the story, hunting for ancient idols (the games only collectible) etc. It’s an open world game in its truest sense in that you have a whole island to explore, at your own pace, with but a few non-respawning enemies. As opposed to a Ubisoft open world which has millions of collectibles, upgrades, and area progress status bars.

It’s also quite unique in that it doesn’t hold your hand, so whilst there’s notes and clues and there are quests, it doesn’t really advise you where to go, when. There are locations with really useful items, and ones without, and you may stumble into a really useful item, or miss an almost critical one and not be the wiser. There are a few upgrades which are really helpful but you may miss how to make them without having done a very specific thing.

Instead, it’s up to you explore, follow quests, or not (they don’t give experience, more of that later) avoid/fight animals and guards, gather loot and expand your backpack (critical). I strongly advise you find a backpack as soon as is possible and then make more upgrades, it’s a lifesaver as there’s a lot of gear you will want to hold.

The one collectible (ancient idols) aren’t massively well explained, and there’s little way of knowing where they are unless you look at a guide. Any indoor location where there’s a hard bit to get to may have one. Whilst you don’t need to collect all you will need a few for buying poisoned bolts which I class as essential. 

When you do a quest for a man named the collector, you can then buy items with the idols and after doing so you then learn how to make them. Others highly recommend the harpoon and there are other good ones too, but seriously save some for poisoned bolts which become available late-game. And save some bolts for the ending.


[b]Upgrades, crafting and experience[/b]
Another big difference from the triple A open world’s is that there is much less crafting and upgrades. You learn to make various weapons, medi-kits, drugs and equipment but really there isn’t a huge amount. I don’t mind this, there’s enough useful stuff to make without drowning you in options. Be aware there isn’t trial and error crafting, you learn a recipe by story, finding the recipe or buying off the collector. You can’t upgrade your weapons, but can increase your storage amounts.

There are inventory slots but most slots like hands have one or two items. I don’t mind this, it makes the game less about gear management and more about just playing, but if you love picking through items and deciding what is optimal for you, then this might be a draw-back. This is a game where you can choose climbing gloves or gardening gloves.

Speaking of which there are no levels, experience or skill trees. Daphne never reaches level 2 or learns a hunting skill, nor does she inexplicably get stronger. You will get better gear and actually threatening weapons but Daphne won’t improve at an arbitrary level. If you will forgive my literary flourish, you as a player will level up, the jumps which at first saw plenty of me falling to my death, become easier to make. Combat you will figure out (sneak up, bash, then circle strafe worked for me) and even though I didn’t have more stamina and strength points I felt like I had levelled up.



[b]How does it look and play[/b]
Honestly Die Young’s island is beautiful, whilst there are glitches (I’ll come onto that) and the character models are a little basic and lacking in variety, the island and its locations are great to look at. Take time to explore and admire the view from up high and you’ll love it, spend time thinking why do all the guards have bizarre bandannas and look like they’ve been cloned from one of the same 2 men and you won’t. 

There are glitches, people have reported clipping of model’s, bodies sometimes die and then drop inexplicably into difficult/impassable terrain. My game was mostly free of that, though I did have one guard who I killed on top of a tower fall through it and off a cliff, thankfully I did not need his weapon! What I did however is the standing up dead people bug. Basically, any guard I killed later on would when I left the area stand back up again and only collapse back when I got close to them. Spooky!

It plays quite well. The parkouring is generally intuitive and it’s great to get the top of a tower/building and be able to see for miles. It took me a bit of learning but I’m not the world’s greatest platformer. Combat is extremely basic with a limited stealth system and not much variety in moves. I just snuck up behind people to get the first blow then circle strafed like a mad man. When you get a crossbow, the game becomes 10X easier and that’s not much of an exaggeration. I’d recommend you leave bosses well alone until you get the crossbow when it’s open season.


[b]Hoofit's finishing thoughts[/b]
I have recommended this game. It’s not flawless but for a cheaper price indie game that’s perhaps a bit much to expect. It’s limited in some ways for good (not drowned in useless options/upgrades) and in some ways for bad; you can’t look at the map outside of the region you’re in. The glitches may bother some, and the combat is just something you have to get through until you get a crossbow.

But it is an interesting island which whilst the end goal is to escape from it, my goal was to explore, find out what happened and look at the beautiful sea from places I had climbed to. It’s sold at an affordable price, certainly compared to AAA games, and it felt good to level up as a person not by killing dogs for experience. 

You do need a bit of stubbornness on some of the harder parkouring bits, have to want to explore and it’s a game where you can really come a cropper at the end if you haven’t got the right recipe. But still for the price it’s well worth your time, and it’s still being supported by the developers, a good purchase, and a great one on sale!

[b]Oh, and save regularly and start in adventure mode until you get more confident.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561199005834090', 'num_games_owned': 1334, 'num_reviews': 205, 'playtime_forever': 1604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1483, 'last_played': 1643760155}
review:
Die Young is a hidden gem that you probably never heard of , a well crafted game with style and elements i haven't seen in a game before , despite me being enjoying this game , i gotta point out this game isn't for everyone.

so what is this game? its simply an adventure FPS consists of survival and crafting/heavy exploration/parkour platforming/melee combat ,, you play as a rich spoiled girl who went to an uncharted island with her friends to spend their vacation to have fun and explore , being kidnapped along with her friends by the natives , you wake up in a well and try to find help.

so whats so special about this game? its no joke , the game treats you exactly like what a lost person on an island is like , and that what makes its it so intense and intimidating , you need to find water to stay alive , scrap to make weapons , explore the areas thoroughly to know what to do , it doesn't hold your hand at all , if you miss a crafting recipe or a weapons in an area the game doesn't tell you (unless its a story related).

the game also a nice progression system , the more you dive deep , the more things changes , the protagonist becomes more ruthless the more people she kill , you find better weapons , better cloths to preform tasks and so on , the game takes a more stealthy approach towards enemies due to the fact you are playing with someone with no experience in combat , but you can go loud if you feel confident , the game has block/dodge system at your disposal.

the island is also huge , there is tons of areas to explore , which are most of the are optional but very rewarding , there is a map and a fast travel system which can be unlocked early on , the map is confusing at first but when you start to draw the lines and checking your journal usually to know what to do you will handle it.

what i didn't like
i'm sorry but the voice acting is awful , not average or mediocre , just awful , none of the characters did a good job in talking or presenting themselves , i am aware the game was on a budget , but the voice actors just don't fit well with their characters 

the boss fights are more than an exploit fights than an actual fight , cause you need to cheese the fight to win them , due to the fact how much damage can take and how much damage they can hammer you with , the normal enemies are fine cause you can dodge and block , but the bosses take far to long time for this strategy.

another note : the game comes with another free game called Die Young : Prologue , which i did play first before the main game thinking it will be an introduction for the game , but its actually not , its more of a demo of the main game that has nothing to do with it 'narrative-ly' , its takes place in the same island though.

finally i would like to say i mostly enjoyed the game with what it had to offer despite these small drawbacks , i also never played like it before , i played games like Dying Light and The Forest which share some elements , but the experience here is unique and a first time for me, also the price is more than convenient for the content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070017805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2266, 'last_played': 1642673328}
review:
[h1] Un jeu au potentiel inexploité [/h1] 

(Joué sous Linux avec la surcouche Proton)
Die young est un jeu d’aventure qui rappelle les derniers Tomb Raider et un peu Dying light. On y incarne Daphné, une jeune femme qui se retrouve prisonnière d’une île à la recherche de ses amies. L’île est découpée en 3 parties bien distinctes. C’est un jeu immersif qui mérite que l’on s’y attarde.

 [h1] Points forts : [/h1] 
→ Le personnage principal, Daphné, est un personnage attachant.
→ La faune complexe : des sangliers qui chargent quand ils te voient, des serpents venimeux fourbent dans les fourrées…
→L’atmosphère réussie, avec des documents dissimilés un peu partout.
→ Les phases de plates-formes.
→ L’équipement trouvé un peu partout.
→ La durée de vie honnête, j’ai mis une bonne trentaine de jeu (soit deux jours dans le jeu) en prenant, vraiment tout mon temps, car, j’aime bien faire le jeu au maximum (j’ai juste raté la cachette d’André et un lieu de stockage).
→ Les musiques.
→ La gestion de la soif.
→ Les énigmes.
→ L’histoire.
→ 3 fins différentes.
→ Le prix.
→ L’excellente traduction faite par le joueur Ulfric Sombrage (merci à lui)
→ Fonctionne très bien sous Linux avec Proton.

 [h1] Points faibles : [/h1] 
→ Une première partie de l’île déserte. On n’y croise pas grand monde.
→ L’IA ridicule. On se fait repérer, si on est dans des hautes herbes, on s’accroupit et on n’est plus détecté.
→ Les phases d’infiltrations sont limitées.
→ Beaucoup de va-et-viens entre les différentes zones.
→ Le système de combat, pas adapté. Il est difficile d’esquiver.
→ Les chiens.
→ Les “zombies” trop peu nombreux.
→ Des zones inaccessibles (je pense à cette immense porte près d’un brasier)
→ Les cut-scènes ne fonctionnent pas sous Linux.

author: {'steamid': '76561198294301173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1208, 'last_played': 1643202525}
review:
Artı ve eksilerini yazmadan önce aldığıma ve oynadığıma kesinlikle pişman değilim.Zaten çok ucuz bir fiyata satın alabiliyorsunuz[ 8 tl cik =) ] :
+Hikayesi ve grafikleri tatmin edici
+Dying Light gibi tırmanma ve atlama mekanikleri var
+Oyunda deli gibi koşuyorsunuz ve enerjiniz az gidip , hızlı doluyor
-Envanter sistemi çok kötü aynı itemlar üst üste birikmiyor
-Düşman çeşitliliği çok az ve yapay zeka çok kötü
-Bazı görevleri tamamlamak çok karmaşık bir hal alıyor önce ne yapmanız gerektiğini kestiremiyorsunuz
Oynarken çok zevk aldım diyebilirim, kesinlikle tavsiye ediyorum.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002684948', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1642370165}
review:
Bon j'ai jouer et fini le prologue.... c'était pas foufou mais ca se fait tranquillou et c'était plus ou moins agréable comme expérience de jeu.
Par contre la version "officielle" ben je me suis fais .... chier...

l'IA est toujours aussi peu intelligente, les pauvres rottweiller (qui hurle comme des loups?) font des bonds de coté pour éviter nos coups.... mais encore.... les "drogués?" qui nous voit en plein milieu d'une plaine vous perdent de vue si on fait 3 mètres de recul... mouais

Le truc le plus chiant à mon gout restera l'exploration de l'ile.... 
Les interminables phases de sauts chiantes pour arriver sur une plateforme avec une porte fermée... des longues minutes à marcher pour arriver à une porte clause... à chercher une arme qu'on trouvera au milieu d'un champs sans aucune explication.... 
Les quêtes indiquent de suivre un certain cheminement mais malheureusement les objets que ce cheminement implique ne sont pas sur ce "trajet".... donc.... ben faut fouiller l'ile... donc ....autant pas faire cette quête de cheminement alors!!!

Les graphismes sont pas horribles, voir meme agréable concernant le paysage (les humanoides moyen moyen....)

donc je ne poursuivrai pas plus loin cette aventure... je pense que la suite et l'histoire doit être sympa mais le coté yamakasi à devoir sauter de partout (et refaire car on tombe souvent), grimper une falaise pour voir qu'il faut passer de l'autre coté car pas de chemin.... toujours devoir grimper, escalader, tomber, mourir, refaire m'a gaver.
Les bruitages... au fait.... ben pas géniaux non plus hein.... jamais vu des renards ou des rotts faire ca :D
Dommage car le prologue avait su me captiver car tout aussi linéaire mais beaucoup plus logique dans le cheminement.

je dirais quand même 10/20 car je pense qu'il manque pas grand chose pour le rendre moins relou et faisable avec envie

author: {'steamid': '76561199063572250', 'num_games_owned': 56, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1646509214}
review:
Moja recenzja: Polecam, ale nie w pełnej cenie, warto kupić na promce!
PLUSY
+ otwarty świat
+ spokojna rozgrywka, expoloring
+ niezły survival, ale w sumie to nigdy nie chce się jeść i pić
+ ciekawe miejscówki
+ crafting
+ dużo questów, pism, ksiąg
PÓŁ NA PÓŁ
-/+ fabuła jest ciekawa, ale mało rozbudowana
-/+ parkour... chyba zbyt prosty
-/+ łatwiej umrzeć od upadku niż od wroga
MINUSY
- mapa: dzieli się na części, nie można zobaczyć jej w całości
- warto byłoby gdyby gra lekko wskazywała kierunek dalszej rozgrywki
- różnorodność i obrażenia broni, w szczególności wobec bossów

author: {'steamid': '76561198251392378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2116, 'last_played': 1606053479}
review: Игра понравилась, прошёл всю от начала и до конца, были некоторые заморочки в ориентировании, но я с ними справился. Так же понравилось звуковое сопровождение в игре. Паркурить было интересно. Кто пишет что нереалистичный паркур, наверное мало знакомы с игровой индустрией, в которой присутствуют такие проекты как: The Mirror Edge, серия Assasin's Creed и конечно же Dying Lyght, не говоря уже о готовящейся второй части игры и забывают что это всё таки игра и в ней можно позволить многое, для этого она и нужна, ещё в защиту хочу добавить, так как в некоторых комментариях говорится, что персонаж как-будто летает, стоит посмотреть фильм "13-ый Район", где большинство трюков выполнены людьми в живую.  Паркур в игре достойный, в некоторых моментах заставляет сжиматься 5-ую точку. Игра со скидкой или без однозначно стоит своих денег.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010529464', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 3817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1722, 'last_played': 1641696124}
review:
I was in two minds about Die Young for quite a while; would it be a game that I recommended with EXTREME reservations, or one I simply couldn't recommend? Well, jury's back, verdict is in. I can't recommend a game in which a set piece boss takes no damage from powerful weapons simply because the devs don't think that my character should possess said weapon at that time. Really, really can't get with this outcome, as it's so contrived and reality-breaking. I'll likely try to finish the game, but it has serious problems with graphics (I am seeing horrible pixels in the sky, for example, on a 1080 Ti running on an i7 machine), climbing mechanics, and consumables stacking on top of the experience shattering bad puzzles. It's frankly a no-go for me. Very glad I got it during the winter sale.

Note: I read that the devs actually patched out better and more logical ways to kill or avoid the dog. Really terrible, ludicrous game design. SMH.

author: {'steamid': '76561198214378672', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1710, 'last_played': 1645374080}
review:
Okay, it's finally time to make a genuine review about this game.
Die Young is a decent survival / horror game, it's not one of those games that scare you.
It is one of those games that sometimes give you weired out / creepy vibes.
To me, personally. It's been very good 28.5 hours of gaming. When I first played it I've been going through a break up.
This game helped me clear my mind and gave me the motivation I needed.
I am very grateful to IndieGala / the game devs for that...

author: {'steamid': '76561198061197146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1057, 'last_played': 1641179241}
review:
This game is fantastic, right up to the final moment. But then the devs decided to completely change the game play (entirely without warning, I might add) and you end up hopelessly unprepared to finish the game.

*SPOILERS AHEAD*


For the entirety of the game, you have to rely on stealth and quietly get the upper hand on unsuspecting enemies. But in the final moment of the game, you're pitted against 12 to 18 enemies (a mix of snipers and melee attackers), alongside an aggressively overpowered final boss.  There's a really good chance you won't have enough weapons or healing items to survive, because you get ZERO warning. The stealth techniques you mastered through the rest of the game are useless against the boss. A single attack from a hidden location, and all the enemies know exactly where you are.  The game switches from a stealth platformer to a first person shooter, but your character remains a weak rogue without the defence or HP to survive the ordeal.
I will never understand why the developers decided to do this!  They completely ruined a game that I've put nearly 20 hours into by pulling the rug out from under my feet!

author: {'steamid': '76561198815748328', 'num_games_owned': 2991, 'num_reviews': 710, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1640598857}
review:
"What if Far Cry 3, but your PC isn't a psychopath?"
I'm not a fan of open-world-survival-crafting but so far it hasn't annoyed me HUGELY.  The initial carry capacity is pretty annoying.  You can carry about 6 things, and once you've picked up a couple of essential tools, that doesn't leave much room for healing items.
There are pre-designed areas with pre-designed linear traversal paths, rather than just a huge randomly-generated map of generic boring stuff.  This is good.  Combined with a bad initial map, it gives a "aim for a distant landmark, but get distracted by unexpected areas on the way" goodfeels of Skyrim and Fallout.
Purchase includes a "prologue" game where you get the crossbow right away.  The other commenters are right, it's game-breakingly good, even if the iron sights are a pain.
