author: {'steamid': '76561198250531624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1593972405}
review:
Un juego exageradamente repetitivo, a la primera vez que lo inicias dice que "Unreal Engine" se crasheo, si intentas otra vez pasará igual hasta que le des a la opción de enviar reporte. 

Interfaz mediocre, sistema de crafteo algo corto y los materiales son una cuerda, un trapo y palos de madera, ah y no olvidar los pedazos de metal.

author: {'steamid': '76561199012593203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1945, 'last_played': 1594772616}
review:
J'ai décidé de modifier mon avis après avoir terminé le jeu, pour une critique plus globale et objective. 
J'ai posté mon premier avis après quelques bonnes heures (je dirais une dizaine) et j'étais assez pessimiste et dérangée par ces points :
- Classé à tort dans la catégorie des jeux de survie, j'ai d'abord été déçue de découvrir que la gestion faim/soif/froid n'était clairement pas un souci dans ce jeu. Mourir de famine relèverait de l'exploit. D'ailleurs, vous n'avez pas vraiment de jauge de faim ou de soif, mais plutôt une jauge de vie car, que vous buviez ou mangiez, c'est la même.
C'est donc un jeu d'aventure/exploration qui plante son décor dans une île bien mystérieuse, pas complètement déserte, mais les quelques habitants non hostiles que vous y trouverez seront suffisamment étranges pour titiller votre curiosité.
- Ce qui m'a énormément déplu dans ma première dizaine d'heures de jeu, c'est que l'exploration se transforme vite en parcours d'escalade, avec un gameplay qui tente de se rapprocher de celui des Tomb Raider, mais qui est particulièrement laborieux et mal optimisé pour ceux qui jouent à la manette. Je ne compte pas le nombre de Die and Retry que j'ai pu faire pour sauter d'un rocher à un autre, tant il faut calculer son saut au millimètre près. Selon moi, c'est le problème d'avoir opté pour le FPS. Il faut bondir au bon moment alors qu'on ne voit pas son perso, et parfois, j'ai bien l'impression que pour réussir le saut, il faut s'imaginer prendre appui dans le vide (très bizarre).

Bref, j'ai failli abandonner après ces constatations car l'objectif que j'avais alors demandait tellement d'heures d'escalade que j'ai cru que c'était l'objectif final, et que le jeu était finalement qu'un simple jeu de plateforme.

Je suis bien contente d'avoir persévérée. Fort heureusement, une fois la montagne gravit, l'histoire continue, et d'autres objectifs vous permettent de reprendre un gameplay moins douloureux, plus axé sur l'exploration, parsemé de quelques combats (assez simples), et la quête de découvrir ce qui se cache sur cette île mystérieuse reprend son cours.

Niveau craft, cela reste assez restreint. On les débloque au fur et à mesure mais ils ne sont pas vraiment très utiles (en gros, des crafts de soins plus améliorés, des crafts de munitions dont on a pas forcément besoin car on en trouve si on explore avec attention...). Concernant la confrontation avec les personnages hostiles, à partir du moment où vous avez l'arbalète, cela ne pose plus trop de problèmes. Cela le devient cependant vite si vous tombez sur plusieurs hostiles en même temps. Là encore, le gameplay n'est pas très opti, mais il semble de toute façon que l'action n'est pas le parti pris de ce jeu. La discrétion et l'infiltration seront souvent les meilleures (voire les seules) options.

Dans l'ensemble, le mot que je choisirais pour qualifier ce jeu : déséquilibre.
Si les différentes phases de jeu étaient un peu mieux dispersées au fil de l'histoire, il pourrait être un jeu excellentissime. On retrouve ce déséquilibre également dans le Sound design : certains dialogues mal joués, une ambiance sonore plutôt simple et chouette, mais dévaluée par une musique horrible au synthé (façon années 80) complètement décalée qui débarque de temps en temps au fil de l'explo, on ne sait pas pourquoi...

L'aventure vaut tout de même le coup d'être vécue. Une belle durée de vie (je dirais une vingtaine d'heures, si on retire mes échecs de sauts à mon compteur... hihi...) et j'ai apprécié le lore, l'ambiance, le décor, et l'exploration calme et douce de cette île, qui révélera son secret aux plus patients.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076099664', 'num_games_owned': 411, 'num_reviews': 363, 'playtime_forever': 2087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2087, 'last_played': 1594556497}
review:
Desde que observe este juego, les digo no me llamaba la atención, pensé que era el típico juego de mujer que solo huye, no me gusta los juegos que solo es huir, huir, soy mas de contra atacar, desde ya les digo a todos, este juego lo tiene que tener en su biblioteca señores es un verdadero juegazo indie, es como hacer una fusión de Far cry  + Dying Ligth, mis respeto a los desarrolladores hay puntos que se te explota el cerebro buscando en este gigantesco mapa, a veces me sentía en un laberinto literal jajaja, te ara vivirlo para todos lo que le afecta la altura este juego te ara sudar, los perros ufff que necedad. Con referente a salvar las partidas guaoo volvieron a la vieja escuela de guardar cuando quieras jajaja y eso uff es muy importante cuando estas a punto de suicidarte en los ricos jajaja XD. una autentica pasada como dicen los españoles XD. los super ultra recomiendo señores. 

(POR FAVOR CREADORES tomen en cuenta esto)
1-Mejorar mostrar todo el mapa, el mapa partido en tantos pedazos es una locura manejarlo así.
2-Que permita crear más artículos, en especial para cazar, porque al final es tedioso guardar las flechas (para lo más importante), porque es una locura crearlas. 
3-No quiten la forma de guardar o salvar partidas en el próximo.
4-Tener mas respawn sobre los materiales como la flecha que es lo mas importante en el juego.
5-Una mejor traducción al español principalmente en las acciones de teclas.

Voces: Ingles
Texto: Español

****Análisis*****
*Jugabilidad: Excelente
*Campaña Horas: Excelente
*Accion: Excelente
*Salvar Partida: Obra Maestra
*Sandbox(Mundo Abierto): Excelente
*Armas: Muy Bueno
*Graficas: Excelente

Calificacion: 9

Nota+Definicion: 10=Obra Maestra, 9=Excelente,8=Muy Bueno, 7=Bueno, 6=Medio Bueno, 5=Mejorable, 4= Mediocre, 3=Malo, 2=Muy Malo, 1=Inservible

Este juego es una locura, metí casi 30 hs en 3 días. No recuerdo la última vez que le dediqué tantas horas seguidas a un juego. Puedo decir q desde un principio me atrapó totalmente la historia, sus misterios, el querer saber como sigue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019578071', 'num_games_owned': 1474, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 730, 'last_played': 1594155395}
review:
Kicsit sajnalom ezt a jatekot, mert rengeteg potenciallal rendelkezett, de vegul kisiklott es egy kozepszeru alkotast kapunk. 
A [b]TORTENT[/b] klises, itt nincs nagy meglepetes. Rossz szigetre erkeztek te egy dogkutban tersz magadhoz es fel kell gonygoliteni, mi folyik a szigeten es mi tortent veletek.
A [b]GRAFIKA[/b] igazabol hullamzo, a kozepes es a gyenge kozott. Meg indie szinteren is talalni jobbat/szebbet/kidolgozottabbat, de a celnak megfelel.
A [b]ZENE/HANGOK[/b] tulajdonkepp mukodnek, teszik a dolgukat semmi olyan, hogy szaladnek es LOOPban progetnem a Youtube-on.

A [b]NEGATIVUM[/b]:
- Rettenetesen zavart a mozgas es mivel ez egy ugralos/maszos jatek alapvetoen (ertsd ugy a 85%ban) pont ez a resze a legfajobb. Sokszor fogalmam nincs miert nem ugrik, ha ugrik miert, akkorat. Volt, hogy 42x ugrottam el meghaltam, aztan valami csoda folytan 43x elkapta es tovabb tudtam haladni. Nagyon frusztralo.
- a szerencsere harcolni sokat nem kell, amit kell az vegulis mukodik, de alternativakent ott lenne a lopakodas, de felesleges egyszerubb mindent agyonverni/agyonloni.
- Van benne crafing, de teljesen haszontalan. Tudod Upgradelni pl. a hatizsakod vagy legyartni fegyvereket, de annyira ritkan volt, hogy kellett, hogy total felesleges (maximum a mobil mento allas miatt).
- Van benne survival, ami kimerul az ivasban(sosem szomjaztam fogalmam sincs mi tortenik, de kb fizikai keptelenseg szomjazni...). Enni azert kell, hogy toltsd a HPd, de ez kb 15 meterenkent elszort bokor boven megfelel igazabol.
- a terkep teljesen hasznalhataltan

Nagyon sajnalom ezt a jatekot, egy leertekeles kereteben egy 10-12 orara nyujt egy "gazdasagos" mirrors edge filinget es el lehet vele lenni, mert a sztori bar klieses, attol meg magaval tud ragadni(van 2 fele befejezes). Annyira keves kellett volna, de sajnos nem tudom pozitivra ertekelni.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979438474', 'num_games_owned': 522, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 1043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1043, 'last_played': 1593390500}
review:
This one's a lot of fun.

Die Young is an open-world parkour adventure game. Contrary to some expectations, it's not a survival game. There is certainly crafting/scavenging for items, but you'll never be desperately managing different meters or building structures.  It's hard to compare this to another game--it's not really the survival game it might appear from the outside. The game 'Miasmata' is the closest parallel. The fluid system of movement pared with rewarding exploration is the standout gameplay feature

Kidnapped on a Mediterranean island and left for dead, you must overcome the island's challenges and escape. The island is huge, full of varied environments and secrets. Above all, a fast-paced parkour style of gameplay pervades. You'll be doing plenty of running, jumping, and even climbing. At times, you will climb to stomach-churning heights that I've never experienced before in a game. Often, you'll make death-defying leaps that'll leave you on the edge of your seat. There were a few times when I thought the system wasn't consistent, but I realized it was mostly my failing (stamina recovers quickly, but don't start a climb on low stamina!). A handy cursor icon always indicates where a surface is safe to climb.

As I journeyed over mountains and through dark caves, a fun little story emerged. There's some twisted things happening on the island, and as long as you don't try to analyze it too seriously, it should keep you motivated. 

By the game's end, I had gone from being lost and confused in a strange land to feeling like the master of the island. The was exactly the title I was hoping it would be, and despite some jankiness and a number of strange crashes in the final third of the game, I was strongly motivated to finish it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167955335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1271, 'last_played': 1593566847}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969417125', 'num_games_owned': 527, 'num_reviews': 378, 'playtime_forever': 1228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1228, 'last_played': 1593025821}
review:
Die Young is an open world survival game played from a first person perspective. The player controls a young girl called Daphne who has been kidnapped by a strange cult while visiting a mysterious island with her friends.

Your goal is simply to escape the island, although to begin with its not really clear how you’ll achieve this, so all you can do is explore the island and try to figure out what to do. Thankfully you’ve been given a map indicating a few locations of interest, which gives you a starting point.

Travelling around the island often involves jumping puzzles similar to a Tomb Raider game, whether its climbing up rock formations and jumping across narrow ledges while trying to avoid falling and breaking your legs, or just climbing up the side of a building whose door is locked, to enter through an upper floor window.

The island is a dangerous place. As well as cult members armed with melee weapons or crossbows, and the occasional large guy with a massive axe, you’ll also encounter wildlife such as dogs, wolves, boars and snakes. You can sneak past enemies by crouching through long grass or by taking another path through the environment, or fight them using weapons like a knife, wrench, and crowbar.

Melee combat feels a bit janky and fighting more than one enemy simultaneously is tough, but as soon as you find your own crossbow, the combat becomes much easier. The AI is pretty dumb and I found that as long as the enemies didn’t see where I was shooting from, I could pick them off one at a time with silent headshots while they stood around looking confused. 

There’s some basic crafting, using scrap metal and wood to make new weapons (they eventually break after repeated use) and collecting plants to make healing items. You can also craft upgrades to your inventory size, and can keep spare items in Resident Evil style storage boxes that can be accessed from multiple places around the island. You need to drink water fairly regularly to avoid dying of thirst, but there are plenty of water sources around the island so its not a big problem.

In addition to the main quest to escape the island, there are a few side quests to find out what happened to some other kidnap victims, or to help some friendly NPCs, and if you explore the island thoroughly you’ll find special items like canteens to store extra water, or clothing which gives bonuses such as improving stamina or reducing fall damage.

It took me 20 hours to finish the game. The story has multiple endings depending on how you choose to deal with a late game quest, but unfortunately the dialogue and voice acting is mostly terrible. Controls are fully rebindable and work well with mouse and keyboard, I didn’t have any problems with framerate but I did encounter a few bugs. Nothing game breaking, just weird stuff like corpses spawning in mid air and falling to the floor, when I returned to areas I’d previously cleared.

There’s a separate prologue where you play as a different character. Its much more combat focused than the main game, which is not really a good thing. Thankfully it only takes a couple of hours to finish but it doesn’t really add anything to the story so honestly you could skip it.

I mostly enjoyed playing Die Young, its a bit rough around the edges in places, but exploring the island and gradually piecing together what you need to do is fun, and it kind of feels like you’re the protagonist of a horror slasher movie. I’d recommend buying it on a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198370030558', 'num_games_owned': 328, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1592391373}

author: {'steamid': '76561198330818404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1614945094}
review:
Die Young is a Zelda-like Experience - The Game-Genre and the way of the free choices what to do next and to build up your experience is like Adventure of Link or Breath of the Wild but with more Violence and Gore due to the theme. The 1st few Minutes, that actually are very important for a Game, it is starting less powerful with a few weak points like the Animations of the Animals and little other stuff. But if you think it was a small Team and what they realized with this Game -Respect!

I just say: Stay on it, and you will discover a very captivating experience when finding out more what is going on on this Island, when you get stronger by better crafting-recipes and developinng from the running Daphne to become the Hunter later...

For the Record, my first impression of the Game:
It is good so far. Other than the Prologue this goes into Exploration, but what doesn't mean you havn't still the Terror chasing you :D ... I will write a complete Review after i finish the Game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019939896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1281, 'last_played': 1590770010}
review:
Il gioco è simile a Far Cry ma con l'aggiunta della componete survival(sapete no?! bisogno di bere e mangiare,fabbricazione di armi e cure cosi via e nel suo piccolo è carino e appagante.
Le scene di parkour/arrampicata sono ben studiate anche se certi salti li trovato davvero impossibili,
La difficoltà è un punto debole si passa da nemici stupidi come i sassi a boss che ti arano con un colpo e che per abbatterli bisogna avvalersi di qualche arma divina data la loro costituzione assolutamente non bilanciata,l'ho giocato a normale ed è stata dura finirlo non oso pensare a sopravvivenza come sia.
I problemi maggiori tuttora sono sulla ottimizzazione, passi da aree che sta sui  120fps e oltre ad altre sui 30 e inferiori senza neanche reali motivi apparenti è inutile se volete giocarlo al massimo vi servirà un hardware potente,allo stato attuale non mi sento di consigliarlo al 100% diciamo di provarlo a piccole dosi nel caso.
comunque sia è un ottimo survival e vi porterà via parecchie ore soprattutto se vorrete completarlo al 100%

author: {'steamid': '76561198322695895', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1077, 'last_played': 1610832992}
review:
Das beste Spiel des Jahres ! Mit Indie hat das eigentlich nichts zu tun , das ist ein AAA Titel ! Denn Grafik , Spielumfang , Story , ist erstklassig ! Besonders empfehlenswert ist Die Young für Spieler die sich Zeit nehmen und denen es Spaß macht eine offene Spielwelt zu entdecken . Man muß alles einsammeln was man findet , das herstellen von Ausrüstung ist aber angenehm unkompliziert . Hat man erst eine Armbrust erbeutet wird man vom Gejagten zum Jäger . Das Spiel ist wie eine Mischung aus FARCRY ( sonnige Insel mit dunklem Geheimnis ) und TOMB RAIDER ( klettern und entdecken ) . Sehr gut finde ich auch , das man den Schwierigkeitsgrad in verschiedenen Punkten sehr individuell anpassen kann . 
Und wenn ich jetzt so nachdenke fällt mir absolut nichts Negatives zu dem Spiel ein , es ist einfach perfekt !

author: {'steamid': '76561198038661221', 'num_games_owned': 6264, 'num_reviews': 207, 'playtime_forever': 806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 806, 'last_played': 1587913912}
review:
[h1]介绍[/h1]
Die Young是一个以第一人称视角呈现的动作冒险开放世界游戏。 您在地中海一个风景如画的12平方公里的小岛上醒来。 面临着饥饿和脱水，您的挣扎根本。。。

[h1]特色[/h1]
跳，爬，利用您的运动和跑酷技能来克服自然的危险和野性！
这不是一个“经典的”生存游戏。如果您打算在白天和黑夜里花很多时间寻找资源或建造庇护所或堡垒，那么这将是不可能的。您的主要目标是活着。您唯一的目的是尽快逃脱。你需要在在炎热的地中海夏季保持充足的水分，寻找离开的方式。
找出您的朋友遭遇了什么。探索这座岛屿，并进一步了解其神秘的居民，古老的废墟，黑暗的矿山和洞穴。揭示岛上安宁的田园生活背后的可怕真相。
搜刮所有有价值的东西，您毕竟竭尽全力。您无法只依靠自己的智慧逃脱。收集可以帮助您度过难关的物品和装备。
自然景观的美粉饰了致命的威胁和敌人。靠战斗是没有希望的。奔跑，跳跃，攀爬，把那些随时会要了你命的人抛在身后。
[code]双语评测，认准我们： [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/35263058-Bilingual-Curator/]双语评测[/url]
Make Chinese and English speaker feel at home： [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/35263058-Bilingual-Curator/]Bilingual Curator[/url][/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561198048786713', 'num_games_owned': 267, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1952, 'last_played': 1629511833}
review: Absolutely adore this game, if you love story heavy games that have a bit of a survival  aspect (like any of the Lost in Blue series), play this! It's wonderful, far better then The Forest. I have tried to play the forest 4x and have never been able to get into it, I have however played this game twice through. So I suppose it's what you are into game-wise.  If you enjoy survivor style games that give you a heavy dose of lore/story. This is it. If that's not your jam and you prefer base building go play subnautica or anno. Both good games of course but to me not super story-based.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026863328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1277, 'last_played': 1654138635}
review:
Upfront Disclaimer: Don't go into this expecting a AAA-quality, Cinematic movie-level experience. If you accept it as something more along the lines of a Mid-Level/Indie Studio offering, you'll have a better time, and may even be pleasantly surprised.

It's best to think of Die Young as sort of a "Wilderness Exploration/Hiking Game, with Survival Elements". The Crafting options are limited pretty much entirely to Weapons/Tools, Healing Items, and Inventory/Ingredient Upgrades, but there's still a decent number of recipes to unlock and try out, which are also spaced pretty evenly throughout the world and story.
The Hydration Meter is in the game, but in the course of my playthrough, it was never an issue (You CAN, however, adjust a variety of difficulty settings to make things like Stamina, Health, Hydration, etc., change slower or faster - so if you really want to make the game hellishly hard in that way, you can probably do so.)

It's a weird comparison, but this game is sort of like a hybrid of Far Cry 1, and Gone Home - a lot of focus is on the atmosphere and exploring a variety of places (Old Houses, Ancient Ruins, a Dilapidated Mine, several ramshackle towers, and quite a few more), with wilderness hiking and material gathering spaced in-between. The story is mostly presented through documents and papers you find scattered around the important locations, and helps to flesh out what is otherwise a fairly bare-bones story. (Aside from some odd voice-acting and writing, the story itself is pretty serviceable.)

This game also places a lot of importance on the climbing mechanics - you will be climbing, hanging from thin ledges, and sprinting to get enough momentum to try to jump across gaps. A lot. And you will probably fall and die. A lot. But some of these climbing areas are definitely the high-points of this game. (Pun not intended). Without spoilers, the halfway point of the game is by far the best part, with a beast of a climb that is genuinely anxiety-inducing if you're willing to invest yourself into it. The developer could have quite easily made this game just about climbing a single mountain and tower, based off of that section ALONE.

Overall Score: 6/10 (Slightly Above Average)
For the price it is ($19.99 at time of review), I would say it's worth picking up and playing through.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989134853', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1065, 'last_played': 1590153184}
review:
L'histoire est très prenante et crédible. Vous incarnez Daphné, une fille tout à fait banale et normale, avec ses réflexions et ses propres problèmes. On vous kidnappe, vous et vos amis, et on vous isole sur une île, qui a tout d'une secte, de laquelle il vous faudra vous échapper. 

De très bonnes séances de parcours sont au menu, de l'aventure, de l'action et un peu de survie. Oui, car cette dernière ne prend que peu de place en réalité dans le jeu. Mais c'est bien suffisant lorsqu'on a le désir d'avancer dans la narration sans forcément toujours devoir crafter ci ou là.

Il faut pousser les graphismes au maximum, c'est un peu dommage. L'IA est assez basique, mais fait quand même son travail lorsqu'il est question de tenter de vous débusquer dans les hautes herbes. A propos, attention aux oiseaux, le envol vous trahira. Beaucoup de petits détails comme ce dernier vous surprendront.

La bande sonore est chouette et les musiques boostent en vous le désir d'action et la motivation.

Pris en promotion, et je suis trèèèès difficile pourtant, je l'ai gardé et terminé. Du moins, j'ai terminé l'histoire principale, car j'ai laissé quelques quête en attente. Bon, j'y retourne alors. ;)

HF Steamers !

author: {'steamid': '76561198032828509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1636378821}
review:
[h1]Die Young[/h1]
[b]УМРИ [strike] МОЛОДЫМ[/strike] ОТ СКУКИ[/b]

[b]Представляю вашему вниманию игру Die Young которая позиционирует себя как проект с открытым миром. Есть несколько моментов которые понравились и которые нет[/b]
[i]Сюжет игры банален, группа молодых людей приезжает отдохнуть на живописный остров в Средиземном море, а там начинается шок, кошмар и ужас. Главная героиня, типичная комсомолка, красавица и спортсменка, любительница активного отдыха и весёлых компаний, обнаруживает себя чуть ли не погребённой заживо на дне глубокого колодца.[/i] 
 
[u]Не понравилось[/u]
У игр данного подкласса есть особенность главному персонажу иметь свой уголок( некую базу, домик, обитель) в открытом мире игры как готовый так и самостоятельно сконструированный, причем где можно спать , мастерить, сохраняться и т.д. 
Тут же это простое меню, «МЕНЮ, Карл!!!», при чем данное меню активируется на определённых точках карты мира, то есть оно еще и пункт быстрого перемещения. Некоторые проекты данного жанра имеют пункты быстро перемещения,  и они работают как пункты быстрого перемещения уж простите за тавтологию. 
Ваш персонаж с самого начала имеет две главные задачи: найти пропавших друзей и свалить с острова. Не буду преследовать интригу, если скажу что при данных сложившихся обстоятельствах по игровому миру, друзья уже все давно и благополучно СДОХЛИ. 
Но теперь, наберите воздуха в грудь, поиск  друзей и исследование карты завязаны друг с другом. Какого...., а почему бы просто не свалить с этого гребанного острова? Отвечаю, время прохождения а также мнимый кайф от игры не равносильны стоимости данного шедевра. На это разработчики и рассчитывали. Я не сомневаюсь что все мало мальски значимые объекты на карте заселены вашими невезучими друзьями, а их в вашем списке не мало. Так что искать друзей и мир смотреть будете автоматически.
Тема с выживанием не до конца реализована, жажду утолить не возникает проблем (повсюду растения и источники, голод не реализован вовсе ( продуктами как и припарками восполняется ваше здоровье), выносливость постепенно восстанавливается, интоксикация от укусов змей со временем исчезает( но можно использовать и бинты).
Мир пустой. Ничего не происходит только статистика ( враги, большие враги, растения, животные, хлам, и вы пытающийся как то себя развлечь).

[u]Понравилось[/u]
Элементы паркура, стелс, крафт.

[i]По моему скромному мнению, открытый мир с технической точки зрения, убил 
игру. Надежда что игру со временем доработают и привнесут много интересного, пока же сыровато.[/i] 
Итог: 6 из 10.

   [b] Теперь немного о прологе игры Die Young Prologue. Это камерная версия шедевра описанного выше.[/b] 
  Что тут скажешь? И у меня есть таки что сказать. Данная версия технически очень отличается от версии с открытым миром, в этом ей помогает так называемая камерность происходящего.
1.Не большой участок местности (камерность)
2.Некий стелс (если можно так его назвать) 
3.Крафт «на коленке» ( его и не много и не мало, в самый раз для данной территории)
4.Пара путей прохождения (как минимум)
5.Элементы паркура
6.История происходящего
 Явно всё выверенно и проверенно не раз. Для демонстрации игры довольно таки хорошо. Есть конечно небольшие огрехи, но это мелочи. 
Итог: 9 из 10.   

[i]В итоге ребята задумали и реализовали в прологе одно (при чём хорошо), на выходе в оригинале сделали другое, а может всё было продуманно изначально.[/i]

[b]P. S. Игра была рекомендована стимом по аналогии с играми которые мне действительно понравились. Так вот народ, доверяй но проверяй, не льстите себе и стиму.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198141161761', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1038, 'last_played': 1632596324}
review:
Переиграла в разные выживалки, но многим не хватает идеи, сюжета. Понимаю что эта игра на одно прохождение, но она не является копией никакой из игр, и в тоже время копирует несколько сразу) В этот винегрет играю 2 дня подряд, и она с каждым разом нравится мне все больше, хоть в начале и были смешанные чувства. Еще одна отличительная особенность, гг - крайне спортивный, а в остальном обычный шлюшиныч, это чтобы каждый шлюшиныч верил в себя!
p.s. Сначала поставила хорошую оценку, но концовка перечеркнула все хорошее впечатление. во первых, концепция, что нужно побеждать умом нарушена, последних надо тупо затыкать. Если вы не собирали горстями змей всю игру, то с последним боссом будете долго заниматься сексом. нарисуйте уже нормальную карту, или дайте возможность двигать эту! час пробегала по шахтам, т к забыла как попасть в храм, ну отчасти мой косяк, но с другой стороны, я ш все игры наизусть запоминаю, ога, да. Пиком наслаждения стало 2 вылета игры на последней схватке и зацеп зп дерево, откуда нельзя выбраться, у меня все, жопа горит до сих пор, не смогла пройти игру, потому что не хочу ходить по острову и натягивать змей!

author: {'steamid': '76561198091075928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3001, 'last_played': 1589427380}
review: I believe I paid $20 for this gem.  I have beaten both the main game and prologue. (play main game first) and I can say this is a great game.  I enjoyed mostly the intricate story (finding notes and random lore to fill in story plot lines) and the Parkour elements (think dying light), the combat is decent with room to improve (used an Xbox 1 controller). Exploring is the main element, (the game hints where to go, and you have to figure the rest out with clues and Lore you find by exploring around the Island). I loved exploring and finding out the history of this Island we are trapped on.  The landscape is gorgeous and the developers put a lot of love and detail in this unique island. ( I wanted to search every possible place and secret I could find)  I played on the hardest setting, which makes you plan out carefully before attacking anyone and being mindful of where campfires (saving) are. Dodging and blocking need work.  Would say it is a cross between Mirrors edge and Dying Light, with a story "like" The forest.  I can not wait to see what the developers have in store for us on their next title (which is in the works).  $20 is a steal for this game, It took me 50 hours to explore the entire Island and complete the Prologue, answering all the questions I had about this Island, its history and the people who control and inhabit this land.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047523667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1600012208}
review:
Das Spiel fängt gut an, aber irgendwann summieren sich die vielen kleinen schlechten Designentscheidungen zu einem unspielbarer Desaster, daher der Daumen runter.

Nur einige Kleinigkeiten:
- Kletterspiele mit waghalsigen Sprüngen funktionieren nur gut, wenn man im Zweifelsfall immer vor dem Sprung speichern kann (verträgt sich hier nicht mit dem komischen Speichersystem.)
- Openworld und Quests funktioniert gut nur zusammen, wenn man weiß, wo man hinmuss und wenn man für Quests nicht über die ganze Karte hin und her gescheucht wird
- Ich habe auch nach 11 Stunden keine Armbrust gesfunden, selbst wenn ich zu blöde zum suchen bin, sollte ich nicht mittlerweile über eine gestolpert sein - dafür verstopfen 1000 Pfeile mein Inventar

Zusammengefasst: Das Spiel ist ein typischer Fall von zu viel gewollt und dann ist nach ewigen Early Access wahrscheinlich irgendwann das Geld knapp geworden und es wurde veröffentlicht. Schade eigentlich.

author: {'steamid': '76561198211684145', 'num_games_owned': 357, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1589303274}
review:
I really tried to like this game but I couldn't. The trailers look so cool but doesn't represent my experience very good. The combat is just boring don't even think of buying it for that aspect of gameplay - the main focus of this game is climbing. If you don't like climbing all day stay away. 

You have a huge open world to "explore" and by explore I mean endless amount of climbing. The world looks very beautiful but fails to interact with the player. There is just no points of interest or something like that so you will have a lot of side quests you'll never complete because they are like "find X" with no clue or quest markers that tell you HOW to find it. 

Navigation generally is very hard. You often have no idea where you are and where you need to go. The game fails to make the paths the player should take stand out from the optional paths. You will often come to an area where you have like 5 paths ... and you have to choose which one you go. But none of them look particulary interesting so you choose randomly ... and if you choose wrong it's not like you will end up finding some secrets or a dead end. No you will just walk 10 minutes until you realize it's probably the wrong direction and you have to go back try another path. 

Last but not least the item system is too boring too. I have done a lot of exploring, main and side quests but never found any item that I found to be cool or helpful. 

This review was brought to you by: Bearable Games https://steamcommunity.com/groups/actuallybear

author: {'steamid': '76561198205542064', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2768, 'last_played': 1589130763}
review:
Très très bon jeux, avec un immense potentiel.
Un excellent monde ouvert a exploré, et très peu de bug a déploré.
Excellente durée de vie également qui peuvent s'en problème avoisiné les 20 heures.
Seul reproche que je lui ferais et que l'on ne se sent que très rarement en danger tellement il y a de possibilité de se soigné et de se sauvé face au adversaires.
Si vous aimé les jeux de survie et d'exploration orienté escalade et un petit peu combat: ce jeux fera votre bonheur.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074592940', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1977, 'last_played': 1691507064}
review:
J'ai adoré ! Certes, le jeu ne manque pas de défauts (la carte ; j'ai pesté nombre de fois sur le fonctionnement de la carte) et de petits problèmes techniques (cependant rien qui empêche de jouer), mais quel plaisir de jeu ! On est un peu à la croisée d'un Far Cry et d'un Mirror's edge, mais version jeu indé, et franchement, ça fait plaisir !
J'ai vraiment passé un très bon moment, un vrai coup de coeur !

author: {'steamid': '76561198147689590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1588867148}
review: This game is a really interesting adventure, with many survival elements. The fact that you start with basically no info about the territory that surrounds you is very atmospheric and stimulates curiosity, you will have to discover the lore by looking around and finding clues. A thing that i hope will be modified is the map, it isn't helpful at all, it shows only fragments of the locations you visited and considering that navigation is quite fundamental in this game, I think it's a rather sore note.

author: {'steamid': '76561198961727738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 2235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1993, 'last_played': 1672170706}
review:
8 / 10
GOODS
--- For the most part, very adventurous survival game, really good use of parkour elements, most of the environments are good, and the parkour sections in the first half are well thought-out (especially the ascent to the High Tower).
--- Probably best played by messing around and getting people and animals to chase you through the environments (and you can throw molotovs at them), it can be good fun. You can also do the stealth approach if running low on health and resources.
--- Really good graphics, decent soundtrack, and serviceable sound effects.

MIXED FEELINGS
--- First half of the gameplay is really good, but second half was only okay, the environmental designs and parkour elements are not as well thought-out (probably budgetary issues).
--- Perception button seems to make the game too easy for me. I recommend disabling it for the challenge. Should’ve been a craftable item instead.
--- Pfft, final boss for some reason is f**kin tough to kill, this guy has so much health XD… I did finally beat him and his buddies in the end, but it took some time.

FLAWS
--- Whole game on Hard mode is probably too easy once you have a crossbow, you can take out regular enemies no problem, the tougher enemies are not seen in the second half, and I don’t think there is enough enemies throughout.
--- Minor presentation flaws and technical bugs in the details.

I think the game would've been a mega-classic, but partly because of budgetary reasons and partly by design, it's only a good game as it is. Ideas of improvements include awkward situations in the parkour moments such as if there were sniping enemies during the ascent to the High Tower, and with some additional weapons like a machete or a throw-able harpoon that kills bigger enemies. Maybe updated patches would help. Though hints of a sequel are there, so hopefully something better can come out.
As it is, I enjoyed the game enough to consider replaying it eventually. First half of the game up to the point of completing the High Tower location I thought was really enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025879493', 'num_games_owned': 236, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 1481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1378, 'last_played': 1667296722}
review:
[h1][b]Warnung: Ich war nicht weit davon entfernt [u]keine[/u] Empfehlng für [i]Die Young[/i] auszusprechen - weil der finale Bosskampf ein absoluter Spaßkiller ist. Selten kommt es vor, dass ein Spiel in letzter Minute noch einen solch negativen Eindruck hinterlässt. Dass das in kaum einer anderen Bewertung erwähnt wird, ist in meinen Augen schockierend.[/b][/h1]

Aber erst mal langsam und von vorne: Was genau ist [i]Die Young[/i] überhaupt?

[h1]Geschichte[/h1]

Man schlüpft in die Rolle von [i]Daphne[/i], die mit einigen Freunden einen Urlaub auf einer abgelegenen, aber idyllischen Insel vor der türkischen Küste verbringen möchte. Der Urlaub beginnt aber alles andere als geplant und [i]Daphne[/i] wacht mit Kopfschmerzen in einem alten Brunnenschacht wieder auf. Von ihren Freunden findet sich jedoch keine Spur und sehr schnell stellt sich heraus, dass die idyllische Insel ein düsteres Geheimnis birgt und es um Leben und Tod geht.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

Das Gameplay erinnert im Kern an Spiele wie [i]Mirror's Edge[/i] oder [i]Dying Light[/i]. [i]Daphne[/i] rennt, springt und klettert durch die Spielwelt, um Hindernisse zu überwinden, Gegenstände zu finden und die Story voranzutreiben. Geeignete Objekte in der Umgebung sind dabei regelmäßig mit einer weißen oder grünen Markierung versehen, damit man selbst beim Sprinten erkennen kann, wo es weitergeht. Allerdings kommt es leider immer wieder mal vor, dass [i]Daphne[/i] eine Kante nicht greift und dann abstürzt - nicht häufig, aber oft genug, dass es auffällt. Glücklicherweise gibt es reichlich Speicherpunkte in der Form von Lagerfeuern, die in der Spielwelt verstreut zu finden sind. Alternativ kann man selbst zu einem beliebigen Zeitpunkt eines herstellen, wenn man etwas Holz bei sich trägt.

Neben dem flotten Parkour-Gameplay gibt es auch noch einige Mechaniken aus Survival-Spielen. So muss man regelmäßig Wasserquellen finden, um nicht einen Hitzeschlag zu erleiden und viele nützliche Gegenstände wie Schraubenschlüssel kann man aus rudimentären Materialien herstellen. Auch kann man seine Ausrüstung verbessern in dem man Tiere jagt und deren Häute sammelt. Glücklicherweise nehmen diese Mechaniken aber nicht alles Rampenlicht für sich, sondern sind nur als sinnvolles Extra am Rande vorhanden, ohne jemals zu nerven.

Die bereits erwähnten Gegenstände fungieren in ihrem Nutzen als Waffe allerdings auch als essenzielle Werkzeuge, um in der Spielwelt voranzukommen. Mit einer Brechstange kann man beispielsweise Schlösser aufbrechen, mit einem Messer ein Seil durchschneiden oder mit einer Schaufel einen Schatz ausgraben.

Es gibt auch einige feindlich gesinnte Figuren auf der Insel, allerdings sind diese meist verstreut und können (und sollten auch) einfach umgangen werden. Dazu kann man sich in Ansammlungen von Sträuchern oder hohem Gras verstecken und wird dann für Feinde unsichtbar. Auf Tastendruck kann [i]Daphne[/i] dann auch eine Art "Spürhundmodus" aktivieren, bei dem alle Feinde in der Nähe als rote Umrisse sichtbar werden - dazu darf man sich allerdings nicht bewegen.

Ein in meinen Augen sehr positiver Aspekt ist das sehr minimalistische HUD. Zu jedem Zeitpunkt hat man alle relevanten Infos auf dem Bildschirm wie etwa Lebenspunkte und Wasservorräte. Gleichzeitig wird man aber nicht dauerhaft von einem Missionsmarker in der Ferne zum nächsten Missionsziel gelotst wie ein Esel mit der Karotte vor der Nase. Alle nötigen Infos finden sich in der Form von Briefen und Notizen im Inventar und es ist leicht möglich essenzielle Punkte von Interesse in der Spielwelt zu identifizieren. Trotzdem muss ich auch an dieser Stelle das Design der Weltkarte kritisieren: Man kann immer nur einen kleineren, statischen Ausschnitt der näheren Umgebung sehen, aber es gibt keine Möglichkeit die Ansicht zu verkleinern und sich alles auf einmal anzuschauen. Diese Einschränkung ist nervig und ich kann nicht zu 100% nachvollziehen, warum genau sie getroffen wurde.

[h1]Grafik und Technik[/h1]

[i]Die Young[/i] basiert auf der [i]Unreal Engine 4[/i] und sieht daher alles in allem sehr solide aus. Trotzdem gibt es definitiv einige Aspekte zu bemängeln, insbesondere bezogen auf die Beleuchtung einiger Bereiche und die Qualität von Schatten. So sieht beispielswiese der Keller eines Hauses aus, als würde nach wie vor die Sonne den Raum ausleuchten. Ein ähnliches Phänomen findet sich auch in felsigen Schluchten.

Auch muss ich die zahlreichen Abstürze des Spiels erwähnen (geschätzt 7 oder 8  mal). Ein weiteres markantes Problem stellten für mich einige der vorgerenderten Videosequenzen dar, die ohne Grund entweder komplett übersprungen wurden oder ohne Ton abgespielt wurden. Diese kann man immerhin als .mp4 Dateien im Installationsverzeichnis finden und anschauen.

[h1]Bosskampf[/h1]

Keine Sorge, ich verrate keine Spoiler zur Geschichte an dieser Stelle, aber das Design dieser Auseinandersetzung ist geradezu surreal. [i]Daphne‘s[/i] effektivste Verteidigung über das gesamte Spiel hinweg stellte das Abhängen von Feinden dar – und das war durch das Design der Level möglich mit gewagten Sprüngen  und zahlreichen Verstecken außer Sichtweite. Nur nach genauer Planung kann man Feinde auch im offenen Kampf herausfordern, da sie extrem gefährliche Angriffe haben und Ausdauer (zum Ausweichen und Angreifen) eine rare Ressource ist. Selbst Hunde, die elementarsten Feinde im Spiel, sind in der Lage ordentlich Schaden zu verursachen. Mit der richtigen Ausrüstung kann man seine Chancen verbessern, aber alles in allem sind Gegner tödlich.

Im finalen Bosskampf jedoch wird diese Mentalität komplett aus dem Fenster geschmissen – man wird in eine Arena gesperrt mit in etwa 4 Hunden, 4 Nahkämpfern, 4 Armbrustschützen auf erhöhten Stellungen und einem riesigen Mann, der ein Koloss aus einer Sage des Altertums sein könnte. Verstecken und Abhängen der Gegner ist unmöglich, selbst im tiefen Gras der näheren Umgebung wird man sofort entdeckt, umzingelt und in Stücke gerissen.

Ich habe diesen Kampf nur überstehen können, indem ich eine kleine, für Feinde unerreichbare Höhle als Versteck genutzt habe, die dazu führt, dass bei Betreten die KI verrücktspielt. Nach dem Beseitigen der lästigen Schießbudenfiguren, muss man sich noch um den Koloss kümmern. Ich bin dabei wie ein kopfloses Huhn um eine Säule getanzt, um Gegenattacken herauszufordern und dann lächerlich wenig vom Lebensbalken des Gegners wegzukratzen – für ganze 15 Minuten. Das hat keinen Spaß gemacht, war nervig und hat mehr Heilungsgegenstände als Gehirnzellen benötigt.

Im Ernst, selbst das offizielle Gameplay Video dieses Kampfes wirkt, als würde der Spieler sich nur mithilfe von Glitches und Glück zum Ende durchschleppen.

[h1][b]Fazit:[/b][/h1]

[i]Die Young[/i] ist alles in allem ein spaßiges Spiel mit einem soliden Gameplay, auch wenn man an den rauen Ecken und Kanten merkt, dass es sich um ein Indie-Spiel mit kleinerem Budget und Team handelt. Besonders negativ anzumerken sind dabei die zahlreichen Abstürze und der fast schon komisch schlechte Endkampf. 

Im Sonderangebot vielleicht mal einen Blick wert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198393825451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1588095282}
review:
I bought it because I`ve read many people comparing this game to The Forest.

Be aware: this has NOTHING to do with the forest. It`s not a survival simulator. You have a linear story and 
quests along the way. If you want something similar to The Forest, stay away from this one and don`t make the same mistake as I have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198806066507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1061, 'last_played': 1588389096}
review:
Great game, very fun to play. I did have some problems with it running at times and then chrashing but that was rear and only happend to me when entering new arear like the Stone Pillers and the farm. I do have some problems with the game though that i do wish to be adress at least in the next game. 
My biggist problem is running out of snakes and thuse running out of poison arrows for the big guys. All other reasurse you can get a more of easily but not the poison. Once your out your out. 
My next problem is the big guys healing after they kill you. Not that I died and got sent back to the start of the fight, I mean you almost kill the jack ass and you make a save point then go to finsh him off but he stuns you to death and when you respone he's full heath and those seven poison arrows are gone as well. Good by half of the Islands snakes.
I also have some problems with the Par core but that's more to do with it clipping though the ground and one time a dog that was near by that was pretty funny.
I have other problems with the game but over all I loved the whole game, it gave me a feeling of becoming the tomb raider the whole time. Just wish I could burn down the WOODEN gate that lead to the main town and kill everyone there and kill Brother 1 my self but that's what we got mods for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057433697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1170, 'last_played': 1588384638}
review:
Creo que un buen y corto resumen es: [u]Si tomb raider y mirro´s edge tuviesen un hijo, este seria el resultado.[/u] Tiene un nivel de dificultad bastante alto, tanto que al principio puede desesperar, pero con el avance del juego [b]y su mas que decente historia[/b] se va compensando, y de qué manera.

Encarnaremos a Daphne, una joven que junto a su grupo de amigos, deciden hacer ese típico viaje en grupo, un viaje que se torna un infierno cuando son secuestrados en una isla del mediterráneo y empiezan a "jugar" con ellos. Tu misión será reunirte con tus amigos y escapar, pero poco a poco te vas dando cuenta de que no va a ser tan fácil y mucho menos cuando no sabes ni quien es tu enemigo realmente, por que sufriras moralmente en varios momentos del "juego" dando lugar a un par de finales.

Un juego no muy reconocido, que sinceramente tenía de lado en mi biblioteca (lo tenia desde el lanzamiento y decidí esperar a que estuviese acabado) y me ha flipado. En uno de los finales, aparte de dejarte con el cul* torcido (en el buen sentido) [spoiler]dejan la puerta abierta a una segunda entrega, si es así, teneis mi compra asegurada!![/spoiler]

Sin duda este es uno de esos casos en los que un juego indie, no tiene nada que envidiar a un AAA. Después de haberlo jugado, entiendo menos que este juego sea tan poco conocido y tenga tan poco cartel...

author: {'steamid': '76561198143107094', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2622, 'last_played': 1588410050}
review:
[b]写在前面，给开发者的一些建议，不过开发者应该看不懂中文罢了。[/b]
[u]有一个杀死养蜂人的成就，能从他身上搜刮到一个猫头鹰的收集品，感觉完全没有必要啊。第一次玩还以为又是一个屠夫级别的人物，结果是个憨憨，完全人畜无害的好吧。希望后续更新的话可以增加一个任务可以用物品和他交换那个收集品，将杀与不杀的权利交给玩家。另外岛上在户外闲逛的狗狗如果可以通过喂食进行驯服那就太给力啦。[/u]

早在EA阶段就关注了这游戏，目前正式版相比之前的版本在难度方面感觉有所下降。虽说是正式版本，还是存在好些bug的，譬如说在最后和兄弟三号的战斗中，如果从货车侧面靠近车头的位置翻上车的话，那么恭喜你重新读档吧，因为你已经完全卡在车上的货物里了。

总的来说游戏的战斗系统略微有些单调，主角比较缺少像模像样的近身格斗技能，而且近身攻击的时候耐力下降得很快，因此想和屠夫近距离刚的话很难（有个原地滑铲的技能不知道能否用在实战当中）。大体上游戏的玩法偏向于潜行和暗杀。虽说如此，主角持刀从背后接近敌人也是没有割喉的操作的，所以还是得依靠弩的远程输出。除开屠夫和高塔处的Boss级别的狗狗外，别的敌人都是可以用弩一箭爆头击杀的。

敌人类型分为人和动物两大类
动物里面具有攻击性的有如下：
1、老鼠，很弱，杀死它后死耗子可以和别的材料制作诱饵用于毒杀狗和狼。
2、蛇，被咬伤后会持续掉血，不过问题不大，记得回复就行，一段时间后效果消失，后期可以制作药物直接解毒。杀死它可以采集毒液，采集工具要后期做一个任务才能获得。
3、鹰，杀死它可以获得5根羽毛，制作箭的原材料之一。
4、野猪，在激怒它后会对主角进行冲撞，杀死后可获得皮革和生肉一份，话说杀一只兔子也是一份生肉，感觉一头野猪才给一份肉是不是很不合常理啊。
5、狗（有三种，黑色、棕色以及穿护甲的），被其发现后它会穷追不舍，可用毒诱饵直接杀死，不过不推荐，很耗费毒液，毒液很珍贵的好伐。杀死后可剥皮。注意不要在低血量和其硬拼，被扑倒后狗会发动其终结技能咬喉。
6、狼，和狗一样。
EA阶段似乎是有蝙蝠的，但正式版本中并没见到，应该是给删除掉了吧。

具有攻击性的人分为以下：
1、精神失常的人，杀死后可以从其身上获取到基础物品，游戏前期似乎是没有掉落物的。
2、拿棍子巡逻的人，杀死后获得棍子一根。
3、拿弩巡逻的人，初次杀死后获得弩一个（推荐从背后用刀进行背刺，被发现后围绕着他转着砍，或者用毒针背刺也行），箭袋一个，弩箭数支。该游戏神级武器，可以从获得之初一直用到游戏通关。
4、屠夫，血很厚，无法被秒杀。向日葵区域手拿大镰刀的屠夫杀死后获得沾满鲜血的钥匙，不过用处并不大，所以不推荐打，遇到后绕开他即可。另外树林的拿斧头的屠夫在后期拿到弩之后回来就消失了，感觉应该也是一个bug，不知道会掉落什么物品，难不成是斧头？

岛上的资源还是比较丰富的，食物和水源非常充足，在高难度下也没有进行相应的削减。高难度下感觉只是随时存档的功能受限了，得后期进入地下囚犯的地窖方可解锁，而且制作篝火耗的材料更多了。其实各个场景的篝火存档点已经够多了，加上避难所也是自动存档的，所以并没有什么卵用。屏幕左下角中间的大圆显示主角当前的耐力，在奔跑、攀岩以及用武器进行做动作的时候会下降，当下降到底的时候就无法进行除了走动以外的动作了，所以尽量避免同时和多个敌人进行近身搏斗。耐力外围的圆圈是当前的血量，从稍高的地方掉落或者被攻击时会下降，可以通过进食或者用药进行回复。最外围一圈是当前的饥渴状态，很低的时候视野会开始模糊，通过喝水，吃东西进行回复。

游戏总的流程并不长，你可以选择逃离岛屿或者加入岛上的社区，逃离岛屿的话流程会稍微长些。游戏里的支线对主线内容影响并不大，比如说收集猫头鹰雕塑和岛上的一位老人进行物品交易，感觉交易的物品用处都不是好大。推荐在游戏前期多搜集一些空的玻璃瓶放在避难所的储藏箱中，这个制作成的燃烧瓶在最后逃离小岛的战斗中是真的很好用！！！后续应该还会更新一些内容，期待开发者加入一些更有趣的内容吧。

author: {'steamid': '76561198043075540', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 2145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1125, 'last_played': 1588542429}
review:
I wanted to recommend this game but it is FULL of bad game design elements and input lag!
Sometimes the character simply IGNORES that I want to run. 
Maybe the 3rd or 4th time I press SHIFT, that is when her mayestic ASS starts to run. 
This is bs big BS.
Sometimes grabbing a ledge won't work and I fall ofc.
The hitbox is way larger than the player or the NPCs meaning I and ofc mostly they can hit me even they aim next to me so it should have been a miss but no it COUNTS.
Animal NPCs mostly dogs and wolves are extremely stupid in combat. For example if I run around them they can't follow me so I can spank their butt easely.
Let's not forget about loading lags, meaning when the game loads a new chunk of the map sometimes the game stops for seconds. Also lag can happen in combat. Which is horrible.
Talking about atmosphere. Sometimes the ambient noise goes off, have no idea why.
Human NPC animations are ok but the animals are poorly animated. 
Animals can not follow the terrain differences so they are walking in the air (some legs are in the air)
Rabbits are drifting and some animal sounds seems to be taken from a BDSM movie, not from nature.
Only recomend buying the game when it's on sale. (50% min.)
All in all the game could have been a great Tomb Raider+Far Cry mix but the execution is poor, even the story and the atmosphere is good.

PS. The Prologue is one of the worst demo/DLC ever. 
Unstable, auto-save only, wanky enemy movement + all the cons above.

author: {'steamid': '76561198242652692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1588097785}
review:
It´s not bad but it´s not great either. Finding stuff is a pain in this game. Objective A can only be completed by finding a spot which is at the end of objective C. The progression doesen´t fell rewarding when you have to scury around the map like one of the rabbits to find keys. 
Survival is minimal, outside of combat I never felt that i was worried about my health or hydration. Comparing Die Young to the Forest or Green Hell is a joke.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005301074', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 1050, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1050, 'last_played': 1587954078}
review:
Aloha,

This is my review of Die Young, it is an open world crafting survival game, you play as Daphne, who's main hobbies include, rock climbing, cocaine, clubbing [bars and boyfriends], and having parental problems. She's fragile and even at the later parts of the game, one dude with a few punches can still take you out. So, the game has an excellent atomosphere, bright sunny landscape, contrasted by insane cultist that want to convert you to their religion of "Love and Peace." The game takes place on an creepy island, you have to contend with not just bad guys, but the environment is out to kill you too [thirst, animals, pointy rocks]. The game rewards exploration with all kinds of items, secrets, and there are multiple endings, and a sequel hook too! The game took me 17 hours for the first play through, I don't know if I have another in me for the last two achievements I missed, but I do recommend giving it a play. It is short, sweet, and fun to play.

The Good: I actually enjoyed the main character of the game as probably the best part, she's fun enough to play with and a change from the bland walking Man's-man meat fridge MC from most survival crafting games give you, No matter how well armed you get though, you still are fragile in this game. And because of her inner monologue, you actually feel like you're inside her. Which was quite satisfying. She reacts to disgusted to the horror parade you are met with [mutilated bodies, crazed cultist, torture rooms, etc], and only in the later stages of the game does the dry dead inside sarcasm come through. The graphics are colorful and vibrant, I found my self stopping to admire the beauty of the environment. The controls are very responsive, and there are big parkour and jumping sections, but I didn't find them obnoxious, like in mirrors edge. There are collectables [owls] you can find and trade for different recipes to craft. The story is enjoyable, and really hammers home the isolation on the island. I played this game during the quarantine, so I could relate in a way, not to the cultists or island, but feeling alone, talking only to people through a radio [phone], all that stuff. Maybe that's why I enjoyed it so much. 

The Bad: the music is forgettable and annoying. I would have prefered no music to the crap they put in. The boss battles are VERY difficult as the game trains you to be a puzzle solver, be prepared, learn to block and dodge early in the game, or you will get wrecked by them. Some of the achievements will require multiple plays to get them all if you aren't careful. Daphne and Brother #1's voice actors are great, everyone else are pretty terrible, like Made for TV movie bad.

The Ugly: Getting "Trolled" ... you will know it when you see it. :'(

author: {'steamid': '76561198798520955', 'num_games_owned': 53, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1290, 'last_played': 1587926436}
review:
Uno dei migliori indie mai giocati. Veramente bello, super consigliato anche se ci sono ancora un po' di cosine da sistemare (piccoli bug qua e la) la mappa è enorme, varia e ben strutturata ma parecchio confusa e certi passaggi non sono immediati. Ottima l'atmosfera che si crea nelle varie aree del gioco. La trama è una storia già vista ma non stanca. Il gameplay è ottimo molto scorrevole e personalmente ho fatto fatica a smettere anche solo per un secondo ti tiene incollato allo schermo. 
Ora veniamo alle cose negative oltre la carenza di animazione degli altri personaggi e vari errori dovuti credo al font nei dialoghi e glitch grafici e di hitbox c'è una cosa che odierete di questo gioco e sono le bossfight, tutte brutte in particolare quella finale (non voglio fare spoiler), è oggettivamente pura merda. Oltre a essere complessa e fin qui ci sta il gioco ha sempre cercato di rendere l'esperienza più realistica possibile, ma è anche terribilmente buggata (colpi che arrivano anche se sei dietro ostacoli, problemi di hitbox in arrampicata) ed è veramente, veramente lunga. Ad un certo punto ti viene voglia di tornare in dietro e fare altre scelte. Con un po' di pazienza la si riesce a superare per carità e  nel complesso è un bel gioco da sistemare ma vale la pena giocarlo

Me he entretenido. He tenido que elegir para sobrevivir. No es la cantidad, sino la calidad. Me ha parecido maravilloso. Me ha tenido absolutamente enganchada. Lo recomiendo al 100%.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978018974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1589281210}
review: Una gratísima sorpresa. Un juego que se ha colado silenciosamente entre los mejores gracias a un muy buen diseño de plataformas y un argumento convincente que despierta interés por seguir jugando e ir descubriendo los secretos que encierra la isla. Los gráficos son muy buenos. Los animales y las animaciones también, las misiones son buenas. Echo en falta que se pudiera interactuar más con los objetos, pero solo para que el juego fuera aún mejor, aunque realmente no es necesario. Desde luego lo recomiendo, como plataformas y como aventura.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969440286', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 3215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1657, 'last_played': 1587667598}
review:
Mir persönlich gefällt Die Young schon sehr, ist aber noch nicht so ganz abgerundet. Die Grafik ist in Ordnung und die Kletterei sorgte bei mir (Höhenangst) für nasse Hände. Es macht super viel Spaß die Gegend zu erkunden, um mehr über die Hintergründe der Insel und dessen Bewohnern in Erfahrung zu bringen. Das Crafting ist relativ simpel gehalten, geht daher gut von der Hand. An manchen Stellen ertönt dann einfach diese Oldschool-Musik, die ich absolut feiere und sogar stehen bleibe, einfach um mir diese etwas länger anzuhören. 

Leider bin ich, ohne mir entsprechendes Material anzuschauen nicht immer weiter gekommen. DIe Wege sind ziemlich verzwickt und es fehlt einem manchmal einfach die Orientierung. Hier weiß man zwar was zu machen ist, kommt aber ohne an einer gewissen Stelle gewesen zu sein und Gegenstand X eingesammelt zu haben, nicht weiter. Die Controllerunterstützung bzw. Steuerung gefiel mir hier leider nicht so gut. Sie ist einfach nicht ganz on the Point. Switched man hier auf die klassische Maus und Tastatur, rennt das Game aber absolut smooth.

Hoffe auf eine größere Gegner Vielfalt und weiteren Kontent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089046862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 2054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1590176238}
review:
Bueno me encanta, el juego esta muy bien, voy apenas 2hs de juego, y se crasheo, espero no sea algo que pase seguido ya que estaba jugando mientras paso esto, y me perjudica muchisimo ya que debo volver a empezar desde el ultimo punto de control o partida guardada, mas adelante cuento que tal me parecio, pero despues del crahseo, el juego es genial

Edit: 22/05/2020

Termine el juego con sus 3 finales! Una locura, un juego que no es caro y me dio horas de entretenimiento, bastante bien. No volvi a tener crasheos asi que mucho mejor, no note bugs ni nada raro, lo recomiendo muchisimo, mas si esta en oferta!

author: {'steamid': '76561197978463539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 1229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1229, 'last_played': 1586911012}
review:
[h1]Tl;dr:[/h1] A bit clunky but fun to explore the island.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Large island to explore
[*]Somewhat ineteresting story
[*]Decent graphics
[*]Main character's voice acting was good
[/list]

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Parkour was more annoying than fun
[*]The map can only be viewed one quadrant at a time
[*]Music would start and end abruptly and some didn't fit the mood
[*]NPC lips don't move
[*]Most NPC voice acting is meh
[*]Final boss was underwhelming
[/list]

[h1]Closing Thoughts:[/h1]

I bought this way back on sale and waited for it to be done. I also tried the prologue which I didn't like so it was surprising that I mostly enjoyed the full game. Some of the level design was way more convoluted than it needed to be but overall, it was fun to explore and uncover things. There are some very light survival elements and multiple endings. It's not bad for an indie game.

Eine Mischung aus Mirror's Edge und Tomb Raider, mit einem Löffel survival und Crafting.
Leider sind die Steam Achievements ein bisschen verbuggt so das mir am Ende 5 fehlen ab wohl ich die Bedingungen erfüllt habe. Aber sonst sehr gutes Game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003954429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3745, 'last_played': 1586723678}
review:
I liked the game very much. until the final bossfight. It was horrible. The only way to win was to cheese him for 20 minutes. Wasn't fun at all. Didn't feel satisfied when finally he dropped dead. Kinda ruined the game for me.

Despite the many crashes the other parts of the game was fun and entertaining.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193261941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 677, 'last_played': 1586727876}
review: Listen I have played this game over 10 hours and it has its fun moments. My issue is the absolutely ridiculous find things for the sake of finding them mechanic. You need A to do B but A is hidden way across the map and does not stand out so blink and you will miss it. They are out in the grassy areas sometimes and you have to rely on notes to tell you where they are. There is no real story except get off the island and roam around forever. Combat is unforgiving and taking on more than one person is not recommended unless you save very frequently. I like the look and I like the parkour style jumping. I don't hate it and I don't love it but I cannot recommend it. I was looking for logical hiding places, a story, and just more overall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053705433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1830, 'last_played': 1586666878}
review:
I did actually enjoy this game while figuring out how to play it, however having completed it now and seeing how that ended in addition to a few other issues I don't think I would recommend this game as it is.

This game did give me a good challenge as a whole, which I liked. There were a lot of clever bits that made it enjoyable. I have not played a survival game before, and this one was a good start to get me into the genre.

However there were a few cons that occurred.

If you miss something, it is extremely taxing to backtrack. Save for a few designated areas there is no fast traveling or anything which as a whole makes sense or you wouldn't have to explore. However if you were to miss a clue or a key, going on a hunt for it means backtracking miles of multi-layered maps. As a piece of the exploration, your map only updates with water or camp fire locations. There is nothing to indicate where you have been, what is there, really what the terrain is like, and you only get one portion of the map at a time. [spoiler] I for instance missed the key on the crushed logger. I had been in that area, but didn't see him in the mess. I had basically exhausted all avenues trying to find the key myself (thinking that I was done in that area), before googling for help and then having to figure out where the heck that location actually is. [/spoiler]

I was getting ready to wrap up the game and started going through achievements to figure out if there were things I missed. There is one to kill a particular enemy so I went back to take care of him only to find out that after a seemingly random point in the game he is no longer available. There is no reason for this, other than he would be a slightly easier kill with late-game equipment. So now I am missing one achievement that honestly wouldn't be all that hard to complete, but it isn't worth starting a new game just because he disappeared from this one.

One of the routes to completion also has essentially a final boss fight, which doesn't entirely fit. I feel a large portion of the game was the exploration and being sneaky. The character is not really a fighter and would easily be overwhelmed if you decided to hack and slash through the game, particularly in some of the late-game bases. But for this boss fight you are pitted against a team of melee and ranged opponents, a few dogs, and a monstrosity of a man who is even more complicated to kill than the one I mentioned in the achievement I missed. All for a character that really isn't made to fight. The only things I have read or heard about were basically people outsmarting the AI to take pot shots and kill them all which is what I did as well.

There are also little things that take away from the immersion. On one hand you can take a leap across a whole chasm or from a small, finger tip ledge up to another. And on the other hand there are times when she can't jump high enough for a ledge because you didn't do it in just the right spot or the dev didn't want you climbing there so she takes this little bunny hop and that's it.

While this game is made for exploring, there are at least two conversations I can think of that if you don't grill the person you're talking to, you miss out on huge pieces of the game. My first run through I did not contact [spoiler] Ibrahim's men [/spoiler] and I didn't actually utilize [spoiler] The Collector [/spoiler] until my game was basically over because unless you act ungrateful for your gift he doesn't mention anything else.

Overall it was a decent game, but there are just some really odd loopholes that were apparent near the end that really kind of killed it for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990478129', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1347, 'last_played': 1587237428}

author: {'steamid': '76561198006779590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 1589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1589, 'last_played': 1586468596}
review: Очень классная игра. Наконец то я нашел интересную игру, где сопереживаешь герою и тут есть прекрасный, умный и непредсказуемый сюжет с несколькими концовками, замечательная музыка. Игра по началу выглядит неказисто, представляется что это некое выживаение с парукром, но это не так, выжитвания тут нет, а паркур это не главная фишка. Больше всего игра напоминает Фар Край 3,  сюжетом, механикой и атмосферой и это очень хорошо. Если вы ищете интересную игру на пару вечеров - обязательно покупайте.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124401288', 'num_games_owned': 952, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1586030013}
review: Не очень понимаю, за что хвалят эту игру. Это максимально шаблонный 3-д инди проект, который может быть создан руками каждого второго программиста-новичка, поверившего, что игрострой - это легко и прибыльно. И видимо они не ошиблись, судя по отзывам большинства (положительный). В этой игре делать абсолютно нечего - игра предлагает через записки ознакомиться с местным ЛОРом, который прост донельзя (Привет, Far Cry 3!). Геймплейно игра ощущается очень неприятно - ближним боем хоть и можно вынести всех рядовых противников в игре не получив урона, если приноровиться, но в этом процессе нет никакого удовольствия. ИИ туп как пробка, пара анимаций ударов и огромная пауза между ними позволяет убивать все живое на острове без особых проблем уже на первом часу игрового процесса. Оптимизация так же хромает, на конфигурации, где всякие ведьмаки и дивизионы идут на ультра настройках в 60 фпс 1080, эта игра умудряется на минимальных настройках при некоторых случаях выдавать меньше 60 фпс. То, как это происходит, для меня остается загадкой. Игрой остался крайне недоволен, советую не тратить свои деньги на сей продукт.

author: {'steamid': '76561198304880811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1191, 'last_played': 1586201506}

author: {'steamid': '76561198111522709', 'num_games_owned': 169, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1586102694}
review: Задумка игры не плохая, но на данный момент она в не играбельном состоянии - 3 краша меньше чем за час. (UE4). Сохраняться в режиме реального времени нельзя, а следовательно - краши вообще не дают играть. Лут не оптимизирован (множество однотипных вещей - никакого дефицита нет), спавп, радиус агро, ИИ, всё плохо. ( ущербный). Разнообразие минимальное.  Инвентарь и крафт, не удобный. Сюжет подан слабо ( скомканно). Ещё работать и работать, возможно через пару лет будет норм ( если выживет). Не идёт ни в какое сравнение с The Forest или Green Hell.

author: {'steamid': '76561198312733378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1197, 'last_played': 1586184722}
review:
ชอบมากกกกกก เล่นตอนแรกจะงงๆนิดๆ เล่นไปเรื่อยสนุกมากตื่นเต้นมาก ชอบๆแต่ตอนนี้ยังเล่นไม่จบเลยเล่นไปตั้ง19ช.ม.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970897072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1586927165}
review:
I purchased this during a sale for $10. You get 2 games, one is labeled as the Prolog. I started with the Prolog, where  it is described as a vacation on an island gone wrong. You start out in a sewer system, looking for a away out and off the island, picking up items, crafting basic stuff, and being tutored with mechanics. The game looks pretty, built in the Unreal Engine.

However as a “casual” player I disliked the save mechanism, which is sparsely placed camp fires. After communicating with the responsive developers, I was informed that the main game (same premise, nightmare vacation ) in Adventure Mode includes the ability to craft campfires with the sole purpose of saving the game. Curiously, crafting a campfire does not create a campfire in the world, where as a real campfire allows you to cook  meat, Maybe since the game is in early access, this feature will be added in the future where crafting a campfire, actually creates one. I have not yet figured out how to harvest meat. A knife does not seem to do that. I’ll go research this online at the game’s wiki. ;)

So, after switching over to the main game, which allows the player to craft “save campfires” and locating the difficulty settings under Options, allowing me to increase my stamina, strength, and hydration (even after the game has been started) this has turned the game around for me for the better.  I’m not going from full hydration to empty in 40 minutes of game play. I can save a game at a time of my choosing without too much effort. With a heavy wrench (found In the vicinity of a broken water pump), a knife I found sticking out of a dead dog, or a home made knife, I can reasonably expect to  emerge from a dog fight reasonably uninjured. Exploration is fun and I’m enjoying the game. 

Of note:
* The game encourages exploration, you’ll find things of interest, and supplies, items. When you are no longer so worried about dehydration, you can more enjoy your surroundings even under the circumstances. ;) 
* The game guides you with objectives, frequently found by way of notes written by people in the game. 
* It  has a fun climbing mechanism like Tomb Raider or The Climb, with a fatigue element, easy to execute.
* There is a perception mechanism that highlights significant objects, people, and animals, making it easier to navigate the landscape.
* Crouching is sneaking, always helpful, especially in tall grass or crops.
* Being able to fine tune the difficulty level for personal preference makes all the difference in enjoyability
* Combat with other than the big sickle hulks, is doable, and makes you feel good about your combat prowess. At least you no longer feel like a weakling, if you have modified the difficulty settings like I did. ;) 
* Most buildings, if they can’t be accessed via a door or window, can be climbed. Look around for a way up. 
* I can’t say how much replay ability the game has. Once you’ve seen and explored an area, you’ve seen it. I suppose you could go back and see what you missed, but at the current price, this would not stop me from purchasing it.

So, to wrap up, being a relatively new player and not that far into the game, I’m enjoying it,

author: {'steamid': '76561198111609671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2462, 'last_played': 1587718275}
review:
Una maravilla de juego, despues de pasarme los 3 finales alternativos escribo esta reseña:
Una historia bien echa, buena jugabilidad, a pesar de pasarmelo en modo historia es realmente complicado, me costo encontrar todo el equipo no vas a encontrar mucha informacion por internet, pocas guias en nuestro idioma y te puedo asegurar que te vas a romper la sesera varias veces.
presenta algun pequeño bug pero nada dificil de resolver.
Es una mezcla entre Farcry, dying light y rusht lo que me agrada mucho.
Estoy deseando una segunda parte.
Muy recomendable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198815247389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1321, 'last_played': 1585929001}
review: Normalde oyunlardan çabuk sıkılan biri olarak yazıyorum bunu. Oyunu 2 gün aralıksız oynayarak bitirdim. Oyun başta çok zayıf olduğunuz için sıkıcı gelebilir. Sürekli kaçmak zorunda kalıyorsunuz. Ama oyunu kavradıktan sonra da bırakamıyorsunuz. Oyundaki tüm belgeler saklanmış  bir şeylerden ve ne yapmanız gerektiğinden bahsediyor. Yani her şey birbiriyle ilişkili. O yüzden o kısımları atlamayın bence. Gördüğünüz tüm ipuçlarını takip edin. Hepsi bir yere çıkıyor. Özellikler oyundaki baykuşlar çok önemli. İlerde birisine satıp karışım alcaksınız. Onu unutmayın sakın. Hikayesi çok sürükleyici. Sinirimi bozan şey hikayenin akdeniz açıklarında bir adada geçmesi ve bunun Türk üst yetkililerle alakası olduğunu falan söylüyorlar. Düşmanların isimleri de Türk zaten. Bunu bilerek mi yaptılar orası tartışılır. Oyun bitimi ise sizin tercihinize bırakılmış. Bence harika bir seçenek. Ya topluma karşı çıkıp adadan kaçıcaksınız ya da topluma katılacaksınız. Ben ikisini de denedim :D . Meraktan tabi. Oyun çok sürükleyici bir şey. Uyku düzenimi alt üst etti öyle anlatayım ben en iyisi daha iyi anlaşılır. Ama indirimdeyken almanızı tavsiye ederim.

author: {'steamid': '76561198849153384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2041, 'last_played': 1588688761}

author: {'steamid': '76561198123990671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1585946078}
review:
Mhhh... Ich hab zu dem Spiel eine sehr gemischte Meinung. Ich habe es bei einem Youtuber gesehen und dachte: Hey! Das sieht echt gut aus.
Gekauft, Gedownloaded und gestartet. Die ersten Eindrücke waren wie auch im Gameplay gut.
Nur nach relativ kurzer Zeit (2 Stunden) üebrhäuften sich meine "Tasks" und ich wusste nicht wohin in dieser RIESIGEN MAP?! Ich bin von A nach Y gelaufen und wusste nicht on ich richtig oder falsch war... Ich musste das Gate öffnen mit einem Schlüssel obwohl nicht gesagt worden ist wo dieser ungefähr steckt? Letztlich habe ich einfach das Gate umschwommen und bin weiter und weiter gegangen.. Ich hatte keinen Plan was ich machen sollte. Klar- Ich sollte meine Freunde finden (obwohl die meisten Tot waren bis auf Michael?!) und dann mit denen fliehen. Naja... Am Ende stand ich in der Basis von Brother 3 und habe alles nieder gelegt. Ich bin hoch zum Funkturm und ich brauchte wieder mal einen Schlüssel den ich nicht hatte.... Phew... Sehr guter Climbing und Running Simulator aber ansonten kann man das Spiel in die Tonne kloppen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982358895', 'num_games_owned': 4039, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1619793024}
review: Voilà une petite aventure type slasher fort agréable à suivre. Le moteur, sans être exceptionnel, nous offre une rendu malgré tout moderne servi par une ambiance sonore immersive. Un peu de combats, pas mal de plateforme et d'exploration, ce Die Young m'a agréablement surpris par son rapport qualité/prix.
