author: {'steamid': '76561197963708554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1548001950}
review:
I tried to get into this game but the game is just too clunky for me. And by clunky I don't mean the controls. The gameplay feels clunky. Everything in the game wants to kill you which I guess could be fine but fighting killer birds wasn't that fun. And the combat? Eh just didn't do it for me either because you pretty much die if you try. Many of the environments feel unfinished. For example in the castle or the small village many of the rooms have nothing in them. They're empty. 

Thought it would be kind of like MIrror's Edge with all of the running and climbing but it's not even in the same league. Obviously the game isn't finished but I am really tired of all these alpha games you buy and then wait years for the final product. You can't even beat the game at this point and I don't see the game having enough reply value to keep me entertained until the final version is released. By then I would have become bored and moved on. I would recommend checking out this game when it's actually finished.

author: {'steamid': '76561198420736391', 'num_games_owned': 63, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2657, 'last_played': 1623605066}
review: 我打到高塔黑狗那里怎么杀都杀不死，只能发邮件给游戏开发商，结果开发商回我只有电击才能打死Cujo(黑狗名字），需要把黑狗往电网引。很真诚了，态度给85分！剩下15分看他们几时把游戏剧情完善了再给。游戏算是跑酷类解密游戏，后期找到长矛以后，两三剑就把瘸子、弩箭手打死了，只是弩捡不起来，可惜！全地图的敌人都被我打死了，只有警棍能捡起，不如长矛好用。遗迹的大胖子只需要爬到中间石头最高点，下蹲，就可以躲过他砸的石头，然后花10分钟用小石头砸死他（前期没有好武器的情况下），全地图的都走了（可能），网上攻略太少，快点更新吧，完整版有了，才有更多人玩，希望下次更新有弩或者枪，然后我就成为钮钴禄 . 劳拉了

author: {'steamid': '76561198095008817', 'num_games_owned': 346, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1547223086}
review:
This is a survival horror platformer but the 'survival' in this game is laughable and parkour mechanics are awful.  Countless times I've died because the game decides to make my character slide off the platform or a wall whilst i'm running, causing me to fall to my death where I have to re-do the entire thing again with the awful mechanics. Of course I attempted to take it slow but the 'platforms' are so small that there's almost no way to get a run up which also makes my character fail a jump, so I die again and have to restart again.

The enemies in this game are on some Ascended Ultra Instinct level of detection with added wallhacks and mods, after completing the awful mess that is the Manor Farm (where I kept sliding off the roof), this dude with a mask on somehow has the eyes of an eagle with 360 degree vision which is so powerful that even when i'm hiding in a bush, with the game telling me that im hidden, this dude still manages to see me even when i'm not even close to him. I would assume that wearing a mask would make your vision worse but obviously that's not the case. This applies to that Resident Evil 5 ripoff guy with the bag on his head as well, where he has ridiculous vision as well, even before I get to the sunflower fields this guy has already started to 'detect' me which is a problem since this dude has literal hacks enabled, I won't be surprised if he's also faster than me since these 'enemies' are so ridiculous.

The only actual threat is gravity because of the awful mechanics and the most aware enemies of all time who somehow can see you whilst wearing bags on their head.

Of course this game is in Alpha which justified it long enough until now where I kept failing Coastal Tower because the parkour mechanics are so awful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119444971', 'num_games_owned': 180, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1823, 'last_played': 1622901358}
review:
Фантастическая игрушка в ролях с похищенной девушкой, которая пытается найти своих друзей, выжить на таинственном острове с великолепной флорой, убегая от коварных крыс, надоедливых собак и других агрессивных жителей, чтобы пройти путь на спасение с острова.

Беги или умри!

Очень много положительных эмоций от этой игры. Затягивает, проходится очень легко и быстро. Отличное музыкальное сопровождение в некоторых локациях. Легкая навигация в инвентаре, прокачка персонажа и оружия.

Игра некоридорная, иногда приходится возвращаться в предыдущие локации.
Змеи и крысы почти безобидные, а волки и собаки иногда покусывают за задницу.

Большую роль в этой игре сыграл паркур. С ним игра выглядит еще ярче и интереснее.

Любителям выживания и паркура, и для тех, кто хочет побегать на расслабоне, на чиле - советую к покупке!

author: {'steamid': '76561198002410331', 'num_games_owned': 641, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1092, 'last_played': 1532964914}
review:
A very entertaining and beautiful but also in every other aspect generally very well made game by IndieGala (They make games?! WTH still cant believe that xD..)
The graphics are, despite the slightly cartoonish look, very beautiful and relatively realistic. The island looks really like a vacation resort everyone would like to visit in real life, without having the obvious problems of course... 
Anyway, unfortunately the game is still in Alpha / Early Acces and has still no "finished end". Without knowing this little detail, you could be infinitely walking around the island, looking for a way to escape. Also, it seems like in this developement phase, there are some quests which can not be finished yet... 
However, at this point I should mention that I nonetheless found no bugs during my 18 hours gameplay whatsoever...
In conclusion: A clear thumbs up! It's been a long time since I was so excited and captivated by a game like this one. 
Let's see how the game, or rather, the end of the game will be in the completed version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111201759', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 4329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1186, 'last_played': 1674549159}
review:
Гра з дочасним доступом яка може захопити вашу увагу на 20 годин. Виживання на сонячному острові з елементами паркуру і крафтингу предметів. Але є один великий мінус в гри: стрибання по скелях; через не оптимізованість, коли ГГ стрибає на виступ, гра може зависнути на секунду і вона падає в пропасть, і це відбувалося досить часто, що дуже мене бісило. Такій грі (дещо схожій на Dying Light) з ДД можна було б поставити і десятку якби не оптимізованість, а так 8/10.

РЕЦЕНЗІЯ ОНОВЛЕНА 15.09.2019.
Вирішив пограти в Die Young після офіційного релізу гри 12.09.  Стало ще гірше з оптимізацією. Довгі загрузки, постійні вильоти (краші) гри, і лаги, лаги, ЛАГИ!!!
При тому , що у мене не слабий комп, змушений був виставити настройки графіки на мінімальні і все одно ЛАГАЛО! 
Зменшую оцінку гри до 4/10 і НЕ РЕКОМЕНДУЮ купляти.
РОЗЧАРОВАНИЙ :-(

РЕЦЕНЗІЯ ОНОВЛЕНА 22.01.2023
Вирішив знову пограти в Die Young і завершити проходження гри і КАРДИНАЛЬНО змінив свою думку про гру. Гра вже не лагала так часто, максимум 5-6 раз і то під час переходу на інші локації, або коли респавнилися трупи ворогів вбитих. Сюжет і геймплей дуже нагадав мені Far Cry 3, і в деяких моментах The Forest.
КРУТА ВИЖИВАЛКА. Рекомендую 
Оцінка 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198244133014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 4831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1102, 'last_played': 1696149077}
review:
I'll give a summary of my thoughts on the game. I REALLY enjoy this concept. The idea of being thrown onto a mysterious island with beautiful flora in search of your friends, with encouragement to explore using basic elements of survival and a fairly indepth parkour system is perfect. It all just blends together to make this pleasant concoction that really works well together. The survival elements are not overbearing and do not heavily influence your abilities or attempts at adventuring, and the combat is at least *somewhat* fleshed out. The story is also alright for the type of game that it is (Although it isn't too fleshed out from given details), and the player character Daphne does have some semblance of a personality with equally as decent voice acting to accompany her. The best thing about Daphne is that she does grow on you, or at least she did for me, with her little witty remarks sprinkled throughout the game and the backstory segments given about her, 
I did ultimately grow fond of her. She does however get very emotional at sections of the game, and I have to say her voice actor when voicing the responses can sometimes get a little annoying, as the voice acting can sometimes go over the top. Despite this however, the game does have plenty of flaws, like the game's piss poor optimization and the parkour system sometimes being a little wonky. The difficulty does have a decent pace, with enemies never getting too strong and your character becoming a little more stronger (Although never overpowered) as the game progresses. The crafting system is simple and easy to use, and some crafting materials are more scarce than others, as it should be. I believe this game can be played in long bursts, but believe me when I say you'll be doing a lot of running and a lot back tracking, so be ready to put up with that. The game never holds your hand, so this can be because of missed items you wanted or maybe because you need to go back to an area for a quest, so be prepared for that. While fast travel is a thing in this game, it never becomes a mechanic that can be abused, as the locations for fast travel are well spread out across areas and some fast travel locations even need to be discovered through extensive exploration.  One issue with the game however, is optimization. This game runs like shit for a lot of people, so if you buy this game, you will be messing around with your settings a lot. This game also has a handful of bugs that you'll have to put up with, but the game works well, most of the bugs are simple excusable ones and none of them SHOULD be game breaking. There's an exception for my case, as I had a bug which prevented me from continuing the main quest line when the quest item and a lot of other items in the game didn't spawn for me, but it seemed to be an isolated case only experienced by me for some reason and regardless, the developers responded swiftly and promptly fixed the game for me. So, one final thing I can say is that the game, despite being in alpha, is getting consistently updated and the staff are very responsive and willing to fix any bugs or issues you may have. Don't be afraid to ask if you're experiencing a bug, because the devs will most likely respond and fix it for you quickly. 

My rating for this game is bordering on positive to very positive. This game's in early access, but the staff are very active and update it regularly. This product looks promising, and I would recommend buying it if you can.

author: {'steamid': '76561198324229369', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 7531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3616, 'last_played': 1639361307}
review:
PROS: The highlight of this game for me was the parkour climbing element. When leaping and climbing cliff walls at great height the game had me on the edge of my seat - it felt like a first person take on the early Tombraider games, which is great. The island setting is beautiful too and I felt very motivated to explore as much of it as I could. Some are comparing the setting to Far Cry 3, but it has a more Mediterranean feel - brighter, dryer and more open. Puzzle tasks were interesting and tricky at times. I found the story reasonably interesting - surprisingly political. Tons of games today play the overdone "Let's enjoy killing nazis" theme, but in this one the enemy are Socialist Extremists / Communists. That sentiment alone will put some off this game and I expect will draw some undeserved negative reviews, but I was curious to know more about the political story of the island as the game went on.

CONS: Very limited combat system. Enemy AI is weak and the psychotics roaming the island are incredibly lame. Voice acting is quite poor even if the story is slightly more interesting. In the second half of the game, after climbing a huge mountain in the first half, the parkour climbing game play element almost completely disappears, which was disappointing. The second half seems to try and build on what was present in the very enjoyable prelude section of the game, but doesn't quite work as well for me. low budget I think has limited the story telling, but that doesn't matter much to me. I can forgive that if there are game play elements I like, which is the most important thing.

OVERALL: I enjoyed it and recommend (more for the first half), but it may not be for everyone. If you enjoy Tombraider style exploration of exotic open worlds you'll probably like this. If you want satisfying combat probably not. I do hope a map expanding DLC gets added that brings the strong parkour elements back in.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974380618', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1290, 'last_played': 1641586001}
review:
Ein wirklich gutes Spiel. Early Access, wenige Bugs, die das Spielerlebnis stören. Gute Grafik. 
Es ist nicht wirklich ähnlich wie die anderen Survival Spiele: Keine Basen bauen, keine Tiere zähmen. Es geht um das Überleben und weiterkommen. Crafting und Healing sind notwendig um weiter zu kommen. Am Anfang rennt man einfach um sein Leben, später, besser ausgerüstet, kann man die Gegner schlagen. Ist auch dann nicht immer einfach. Wenn ein Hund einen überraschend tötet... nun ja, auch nach dem 10ten Mal ist es irgendwie unangenehm. 
Wenn der Avatar stibt, spawnt man an bestimmten Savepoints wieder. Später im Spiel kann man überall Speichern (mit dem Rezept und dem Material dafür).
Man muss viel Klettern, Suchen, die Karten sind nicht auf Norden geeicht, also teilweise nicht so einfach sich zu orientieren. Wer nicht schwindelfrei ist, der wird beim erreichen des Turms viel Spaß haben...
Bisher ist das Spiel nicht durchspielbar, es Endet bisher an einem Zaun.
Nach und nach bekommt man die Story erzählt, wenn man sich mit den (immer vermummten) NPCs unterhält.

Ich fand das Spiel erfrischend anders. Keine wirklich neuen Inhalte, aber anders zusammengestellt. 

Die Gegner sind nicht wirklich vielseitig, aber das Klettern schon. Teilweise muss man viel Suchen um den richtigen Weg zu finden. 
Alles in Allem ein gelungenes Spiel. Klare Empfehlung. Preis / Leistung ist definitiv ok.

author: {'steamid': '76561198336778126', 'num_games_owned': 444, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 916, 'last_played': 1597398810}
review:
A fantastic Title, differentiated from the norm, yet rooted in classica.

Story
I have not yet uncovered all of the secrets to be found in this place, but I am beginning to realise the ultimate Gist of the nature of this island. The story is simple, heavily lore-based and almost entirely optional. However, it strikes true with a number of fundamental philosophies of our species and perhaps focuses on aspects of humanity which are much neglected by great swathes of modern Humanity.

Atmosphere
This game is easily considered a Horror Survival, until you start playing. A cacophany of delicately beautiful and warm sights await your eyes, and the gentle breeze of the purest Sea air will whistle through your ears. The view from any number of heights is breathtaking and even though kidnapped, you may well feel a true sense of expedition for Daphne, your Character.

Then you suffer the thirst of some island inhabitant... Some predators are clever, some are fast, some are finicky, some are annoying. All pose a real threat to your life (I play Hardest Difficulty FYI). I will not describe any of the dangers you will face, but each present you with limited options for escape or victory, so you must decide fast, and commit to your plan.

I adore the way in which intense life-threatening fears can be woven in and out of such a gorgeous and peaceful setting.

Mechanics
Firstly, Combat. In the beginning, I thought that Stealth was my only option for many situations, then after some hours of playing, I was finally prompted to 'Hold W A S or D and press Spacebar to Dodge.'. Now I am able to happily compete with some foes, but must still avoid others. The combat is not flawless, but when you get used to how enemies move a little it becomes essentially difficult to get hit, unless you are fighting something which you may not be advised to.

Secondly, Survival. The crafting in this game is simple, but enjoyable. A small range of plants can be found throughout the island, which have varied uses. Should you bother to pick them up, you will not want for healing - for example - and will be able to keep a stock of healing items ready for accidents and surprises. Furthermore, if you hunt a few Hide-bearing animals and upgrade your Component Storage as soon as you are able, you will feel more than satisfied with the number of spare materials you can hold on to, until you know what you want to craft.

Thirdly, Climbing. I honestly feel like Im playing the oilder Tomb Raider games, but you kind of have to try to miss you next handhold, the game is quite forgiving with not letting you jump in a direction which is absolutely nowhere near any path of travel. However, you are limited by your Stamina, and will fall (often to your death) if you spend a long time hanging halfway up a structure without seeing the next hold. Fortunately, only the most unobservant of players will suffer this, as the 'cooldown time' between transitions is very short, allowing for very fast climbing if you observe your path beforehand. Honestly though, I always find my path WHILST I climb and have never lost my grip due to low Stamina.

Overall
I absolutely love this game. When I bought it (as Early Access) I assumed I would be depressed, imagining all the things that could be added to it, which probably won't be. However, within an hour I already felt I had enjoyed it enough to justify the discounted price of roughly 8 GBP that I paid for it. By this point I would have paid 12-15. If the map ended up (by release) being filled with a large amount of lore and hinted backstory about the kidnapees of the island, I could easily imagine people paying 25 or more and being happy (assuming they like the genre, etc).

If you like being scared, being wary and playing things like the MYST series, this game is for you. If you like First Person Parkour and tense climbing stretches, this game is for you. If you like being genuinely likely to die, the Highest Difficulty of this game is... 90% for you (could be a little harder with more foes n stuff, but that increase could get real frustrating aswell).

author: {'steamid': '76561198059802982', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1541573043}
review: There's been no save point for a while, and I need to heal. Well, here goes some cloth. What's this? I can't pick it up, it's almost as if it's trying to claim I specifically can't pick up anymore string or cloth ... but that makes no sense whatsoever. yet I still have space for other items. OK, well, I know what to do. I'll just make some trusty healing powder out of these rare flowers, surely that will free up some space, I will most certainly just assume that the product of my crafting will not, somehow, take up MORE inventory space than its constituent items. Oh, no, after crafting the healing powder, it says my inventory is overall full. What happened to the weird rule of only being full in regard to specific items? Well then, to free up space all I have to do is consume the healing powder which will ... not fucking heal me but will use my healing powder despite the fact, confirming that I did consume it. No, weird status effects caused it, the game just up and wasted my healing powder at a crucial time. Huh, it's almost as if, despite its potential, this is currently a shit game that I should regret buying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020403092', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1538971199}
review:
ACTUALLY SECRELY A JUMPING PUZZLE GAME WHY.

I wanted to love this game so much. It's exactly my style. What started as a somewhat unique take on survival horror and exploration--don't hole up, don't worry about the long term, just get the hell out ASAP--ended up a disappointing jumping puzzle game/stealth game with confusing controls. 

The jumping puzzles are everywhere and extremely frustrating. It's not clear whether you'll make a jump, the mechanics are clunky, and it's unforgiving of mistakes considering they often end in death and it's not easy to save whenever you want. To save, you have to either find a fire pit or create one. 

It's too bad because I was interested in the plot and exploring the map.

If you want a game with a similar flavor, pick The Forest instead. The enemies are scarier and the mechanics are more intuitive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135955605', 'num_games_owned': 705, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 812, 'last_played': 1662061209}
review:
Великолепная игра.
Можно много что сказать, но буду краток.

Игра про исследования, большое кол-во игрового времени вы потратите именно на перемещение по острову и поиск новых мест. Одна большая локация, которая тщательно забита различными строениями. И это безумно интересно.
Система паркура довольно динамична, но при это иногда встречаются баги с застреванием в текстурах.
Вы будете редко погибать от врагов, скорее из-за падений со скал. (90% смертей)
Графика, музыка, сеттинг - всё это очень атмосферно.
Слишком много животных, иногда ты не можешь перебежать кролика, просто застреваешь на нём и падаешь со скалы. 

Всё очень приятно играется, покупать можно и по полной цене. 
Как минимум 7/10, если вас волнует именно такая оценка.

author: {'steamid': '76561198834056230', 'num_games_owned': 89, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1424, 'last_played': 1568969693}
review:
很好玩，就是刚玩的时候完全摸不着头脑【对探索解密类要求略高，需要耐心。关键好像也没有什么攻略】
目前这款游戏没有开发完，最后大黑狗boss只能利用电网电死【站在电网前（注意不要电到自己）它扑向你的时候闪开，它会撞到电网上】电一次并不能杀死大黑狗，你需要重新打开电网开关。
另外还有一个难受的关卡是靠海边别墅地下室的狗【别墅进不去，可以从旁边的高坡上跳到二楼，里面有这栋楼的钥匙】，拷问室里面吊着一个死人，旁边也有一个黑狗。有个钥匙因为有狗也拿不到，旁别的木箱子撬开有罐头，绕道另一边你会发现可以给狗喂食。但是喂普通的罐头并不管用。你需要一个诱饵配方【那个配方是有毒的，具体叫什么我忘了】喂给它就死了。那个配方是在前期关卡获得的——这个游戏难就难在他是个开放的生存游戏，没有具体的指引和规则。没有了限制是不是不知道该干啥？你可以跳过新手关卡，直接去第三关？？等开发完了我有点期待结局是什么？

author: {'steamid': '76561198039039453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 526, 'last_played': 1536623652}
review: I don't usually give reviews to games, so this should tell you how good of a game this is. Many Early Access games don't achieve the level that this game has. The story is pretty interesting, the gameplay mechanics remind me of Dying light and Mirror's Edge, and the sights and atmosphere of this game are great. I'm not done with the game yet and I will continue to play it, but so far it deserves a good review. This game has a lot more coming to it i'm guessing so I'm excited to see what the devs do with it. If you like exploring games with mild crafting systems and a bit of horror, then this game will serve you good. Keep up the great work devs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198391661979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1536046327}
review:
目前不太推荐入手这款游戏，除非你很期待这款游戏后续更新
先说几点
1：这游戏汉化没做完，改完语言你会发现菜单都才汉化一半令人哭笑不得，哪怕你把第一章做完再来让玩家抢新体验给玩家一个好的第一印象啊。
2：主角身为一名猛女，只有在有武器的时候才肯动手，遇到敌人手中没有武器的话只能当逃兵76。（不能撕逼差评）
3：新手引导与其说不好不如说根本没有。就几个按键提示就没了，希望后续更新能完善
4；需要优化，玩起来还是有掉帧卡顿的现象

author: {'steamid': '76561198180908510', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 4715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1008, 'last_played': 1594696604}
review: Hacía mucho que no me enganchaba 6 horas seguidas. Siendo claro es PLATAFORMAS y PASEO. Me recuerda al premiado Firewach en una historia vaga que suscita suficiente intriga, con misiones ligeras, y mientras vagas por un entorno estimulante...  pero aquí el mapa es mayor y más complejo: consigue variedad y sorpresa en todo ese mapa,y el requerimiento de atención en cada esquina es necesario para evaluar los peligros y las alternativas... hay que explorar cada bifurcación y rincón del mapa, y si no te fijas comienzas a vagar en círculos. Creo que está bien dimensionado y todo aderezado por un sonido y música bien elegidos. Resulta curiosa la fórmula de mezcla de realismo gráfico (Unreal) y de virtualización idealista... quiero decir que todos los puntos de interás son puzzles 3D de plataformas (una mansión o una torre real no se parecería nada realmente a lo que propone el juego) y la experiencia de escalada de una montaña real tampoco se parecería a la que propone el juego pero en esencia diría que las sensaciones sí se parecen a las mismas que consigue el juego... conteniendo la respiración cada pocos saltos, por el paisaje, el mapa o la tensión de "a ver si llego". A mejorar: la simplicidad de las localizaciones [probé la Alpha] y algunos puntos de los puzzles que dejan confuso (p.ej. : para abrir alguna puerta tienes que esperar a encontrarla casi en el otro lado del mapa, cuando ya tiraste la toalla de poder abrirla y se te ha pasado la digestión de que  esa llave aparecería).

author: {'steamid': '76561198255589765', 'num_games_owned': 341, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 5466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2170, 'last_played': 1688578188}
review: Mélange unique d'exploration en monde ouvert et de plate forme à la première personne avec un zeste de survie, Die Young est comme un croisement entre Far Cry 5 (sans les armes à feu) et Mirror Edge. D'esprit contemplatif, le jeu réussit néanmoins à offrir des phases d'action haletantes, qui ne laissent aucune place à l'erreur. Le contraste entre la beauté de l'île et les dangers qui la parsèment crée une ambiance extraordinaire, pesante et mélancolique. Le gameplay est exigeant: la moindre chute d'importance est fatale, on ne peut pas sauvegarder à tout bout de champ, et les ennemis ne pardonnent pas. A noter aussi, une heroïne qui, malgré des capacités athlétiques très élevées, diffère pas mal des potiches à la Wonder Woman dont on a l'habitude. Superbe, immersif et prenant, ce jeu est une véritable pépite.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095440758', 'num_games_owned': 404, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1533042372}
review:
[h1] Excelente juego[/h1] a pesar de estar en versión alfa. Un juego tipo survival algo diferente a lo que vemos normalmente, ya que combina puzzles de escalada con parkour. Te aconsejo que le eches un vistazo a este vídeo para que veas todo el potencial del juego 👉https://youtu.be/wtbP9PPv2qA

Se encuentra parcialmente en español, por lo que aún te encontrarás cositas en inglés. La música es lo más y la ambientación está muy bien lograda.

En el juego encarnamos el papel de una chica que se despierta dentro de un pozo en una isla del mediterráneo. Separada de sus amigos, con los cuales había llegado a la isla, debe explorarla, para encontrar a sus amigos y sobre todo conseguir salir con vida de la isla, ya que los lugareños son al más puro estilo la matanza de Texas, por lo que intentarán ir a por nosotros en todo momento.

Podremos crear objetos, los cuales para crearlos deberemos ir recogiendo objetos que estarán en la isla, así como alguna que otra receta para poder crear nuevos objetos.

¡Un saludo! Y no te olvides echarle un vistazo al vídeo ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198031187918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1475, 'last_played': 1532208960}
review:
This game definitely gets a thumbs up for its great graphics and dense atmosphere. It reminds me a lot of the older FarCry games in both keeping the balance between open world and storytelling as well as game features and how controlling your character feels. Even in its current state of development (Alpha 0.7), it delivered on all of my expectations.

However, it also clearly is an Alpha version at this point. So, be prepared for having to deal with:
- Inaccurate controls of your character, which can get very frustrating during the parcours parts of the game
- Glitches, invisible walls and occasionally getting stuck between trees or while crouching
- Really low AI-level on enemies (not necessarily an issue, as it currently helps to balance the game in your favor)
- Some quests that cannot be fully solved yet
- Missing an ending to the story (to be released in v 1.0)

None of the above makes the game less good or make me lower my rating. This is an early access game that already contains a lot of content and, judging from what has been accomplished so far, is on a good way to receiving its final polish for an appropriate version 1.0. Looking forward to it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197976478038', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1216, 'last_played': 1542524040}
review: I rarely write reviews for games, but I can't help but praise Die Young. I'm posting this review after having played the game all night -  I can't believe how good it is! I thought I would put a couple of hours into it and get bored like I usually do with survival or crafting games. But I've put in nearly 20 hours (which is a lot for me most of the time...) and I've still got a couple of areas left. I love how beautiful the game looks. The developers have clearly put a lot of effort into making this game look amazing. I love the parkour and climbing elements of the game. I keep exploring every nook and cranny just to see what I can find. I had maxed out my inventory space by the time I found two other pack upgrades because of how much fun the crafting is. You start out really weak, and have to be stealthy to even survive. But now that I have multiple weapons and plenty of health items it is fun to go after enemies. I've only found a couple of areas that don't look completely finished so this game has got to be nearing completion. I've not arrived at the final area yet, so I'm not sure how the current end to the game is, but with how much fun I've been having, I really don't want it to end anyway.  I highly recommend this game in either early access or its completed state.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975985893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1139, 'last_played': 1573264609}
review:
I see, to my surprise, see that I've played 19 hours of this game.  I have never done that with an Early Access title before and I now look forward to playing through again with the new enhanced graphics that they've added.  And I'll be damned if I know why I enjoy it that much but after thinking a bit, here's what I decided...

[list]
    [*]The game doesn't redefine the nature of gaming or add never seen before mechanics or leave you pondering a deep story line.  It just does what it does in all the right proportions.  
    [*]It's a little survival (you have to eat and drink and heal) but doesn't make it punishing.  
    [*]It's a little platformy with a fair amount of run and jump, some challenging, but not impossible even for a really bad twitch player like myself.  
    [*]It's a little crafty but doesn't take it too far and get lost in the intricacies of inventory or dump huge lists of possible items and improvments on the player. 
    [*]All you're really doing story wise is exploring the island and trying (maybe) to get off but there's just enough mystery to keep it interesting until they fill it in a bit and it's enough for now
    [*]You deal with enemies by using your limited fighting skills and/or drawing them out, or by running away until you get stronger or smarter and that's the way it should be.
[/list]

I expect all these aspects will be refined and the story become more involving as the final content is added but, for now, we already have a really great looking game that does a very good job of balancing the gaming elements so that I, for one, felt I was playing the game not overcoming the game.  

I almost didn't pick this game up because of the name and the feeling that this was a horror/survival game but although it has elements of those it is really more of an exploration/light RPG style so if you're as tired of dark dungeons as I am, well, so far at least we're good.  I'm kind of relieved to have a game that just wants me to play it and not devote a huge chunk of my life to.

I'm only concerned that they're not charging enough since even at full price I think it's a deal :)

Recommended

author: {'steamid': '76561197971246373', 'num_games_owned': 959, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1530416807}
review:
Why punish the player for playing? No instructions for anything. I understand its trying to come across as a very-realistic survival game but when you leave the player with no understanding of what to do you get a lot of deaths. The enemies are in abundance and you absolutely cannot evade them, you MUST fight, but how can you do that with knives that break after 5 hits and sticks that somehow last longer? And why can't I throw a punch?! What's so hard about that?!
Refunded. Maybe I'll try it again in the futue but who am I kidding? I was so unimpressed with the hour I played it for that I don't want to bother with this game ever again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198235863340', 'num_games_owned': 1659, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1529925511}
review:
好吧首先我选择死亡！
游戏刚开始你会漫无目的的在大草原上翱翔，撒欢的跑，然后你就会莫名其妙的被各种动植物追。你追我 如果你追到我，我就让你嘿嘿嘿！！！被猪追、被狗追、被蛇追、被狼追。
起初在屏幕上你会发现一个黄色的感叹号，正当劳资拿着木棍蹲下阴草丛悄悄地摸索过去時，你就会发现tmd音乐变了，非常之激烈（咚咚咚咚咚咚咚咚）。
只想給个中评，毕竟游戏画面，探索，逃生都是我喜欢的类型！但是我就奇他妈了个逼的怪了，跳个鸟窝要摔死多少次！不断的重来重来重来，走边边会滑下去（可是我穿鞋了啊）真的没有耐心，这是跑酷游戏吗！至少在我没消气之前是不会改好评的，除非……返现10元！！！！！！
告辞（拱手）！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198368672785', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1529936472}
review:
<消逝>
       一个开放世界，以第一人称视角的动作冒险游戏。你醒了，在一个风景如画的12平方公里的小岛上，饥饿、脱水，这都不是事，你的冒险之旅才刚刚开始。跳、跑、爬，快利用你的跑酷来克服各种潜在的危险！（主角居然是姑娘）

       首先，还在体验版本，简中并不完整，只有界面简单的 中文，设置里大部分还是英文，游戏里也是如此，攻略显得少，不过并不影响，后补齐就OK，游戏发展潜力还是有的。
       第一视角游戏玩多了，头晕没出现，有3D眩晕的就另考虑，这类游戏建议把视角开大会减少眩晕。
       其次，1070开超级玩着还是很流畅，画风也不错，处于写实和2.5D之间吧。

       被追赶得BGM满分。类似跑酷，再加上动感的BGM，减少了紧张感。

       目前只有单人冒险和生存模式两种，就等往后出多人联机了~

author: {'steamid': '76561198154956857', 'num_games_owned': 1986, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 1009, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 799, 'last_played': 1575783661}
review:
Bah, que jogo divertido, pena que ainda tem uns bugs bem chatinhos, mas ainda assim consegui gostar pra caramba.

No início achei que esse jogo era bem parecido com Dying Light, mas não é bem assim. Diferente do DL, se você errar um pulo, vai cair de uma altura absurda, e então só vai ter tempo de ouvir o som de um osso quebrando, um gemido, e a tela de TOMOU NA JABIRACA TROUXÃO (ocasionalmente, a culpa nem é sua, já que o jogo ainda tem alguns bugs, que se manifestam nesses momentos).

Algo que eu não sabia até jogar o jogo, é que ele era de sobrevivência (pois é, eu peguei sem nem ler as análises direito kkkkkkkkk), e mesmo assim continuei gostando dele (afinal isso não é um ponto negativo necessariamente), já que o parkour é bem divertido. Tem momentos que dá um frio na barriga, já que você pode estar no topo de uma montanha, e tem que fazer um salto que parece impossível.

Bem, como é um jogo de sobrevivência, os inimigos não são tão fáceis como eu imaginava que seriam, por isso tive alguns momentos de desespero, fugindo de um cachorro só porque ele me viu, mas também gerou alguns momentos engraçados, como uma guerra de pedras com um dos inimigos, onde eu tocava uma pedra que cabia em minha mão, enquanto ele tocava uma que cabia na dele, que no caso era uma do meu tamanho.

No momento que eu fiz essa análise o jogo ainda não está completo, o modo história ainda tem uma parte faltando, e para mim ainda falta um certo polimento, tanto na jogabilidade e no desempenho, quanto nos menus e legendas, porque, pelo menos em português, o jogo está com a tradução incompleta e mal traduzida.

Acredito que o jogo tem um potencial muito bom, porque mesmo estando incompleto, ainda consegui me divertir muito.

review:
Looks and feels really nice and overall one of the most interesting game ideas I've seen in a long time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967260333', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 1828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1588482364}
review:
The game looks really promising but there is still a lot to be done. It does not have very sophisticated graphics and I still have problems running it smoothly. It screenlags quite often. Movement, especially jumping,  needs to be fixed. Physics in general needs a hotfix because some of the movements are quite "clumsy". I have experienced one more annoying bug. Sometimes the character will just randomly appear in the sky and of course fall to the ground and die. Happened to me 3 times. 

Even though graphically this game is not the sharpest tool in a shed I enjoyed playing it quite a bit. I like the atmosphere and plot looks solid for now as well. If you guys fix those little annoying things that sometimes make it really atrocious to play, especially when you spend quite some time climbing and then your character doesn't jump just randomly falls down, and all the progress goes down the drain.

I do not think this game will be better than titles like The Forest even in the final version, however, I can't wait for the first stable running version. I will go back from time to time and if I see that some improvements have been made I will definitely try beating the game.

UPDATE:

So I decided to give it a go, having seen some official stable version was released and I am really torn. On one hand I really enjoy the map, playing the game gives me tons of fun, even though I have to replay some scenarios multiple times.

To this need of replaying - it's still those same things as I experienced 2 years ago... Screenlagging is just painful.I tried setting everything on low with square shadows etc. and it still didn't help. I don't understand why because people have been complaining about this since I remember.

Anywho, I can sorta turn a blind eye on those lags, as it feels like there is fewer of them these days, and if I do, this game is pretty good. It's not the forest as I stated 2 years ago, but I think the plot itself may be a bit more interesting here (Dying Light feels more action packed). I see a lot of differences between these games too actually. I think that Die Young is closer to Dying Light than The Forest or Green Hell. It feels like more of a parkour game less survival to be honest. All in all, solid effort, I still have some of the plot to go, I will update one more time when I finish the game :)

UPDATE #2

Alright, having beaten the game I have to change my opinion about those screenlags. I have nearly given up on multiple occassions. Bottomline, the more open the map gets, the higher you go, the more frustrating those lags become... I do not want to even mention the last fight which I am pretty sure has shortened my life by 5 years due to cardiac issues...

When it comes to the survival part of this game - the only survival part is that you have to literally survive the island. Dehydration is non issue, due to multiple water sources, but it's not the main point. The main point is that Die Young is not a survival game per se, which is not necessarily a disadvantage. It is a parkour/craft game, sort of like Dying Light more than The forest etc.

I loved the plot, game gave me a lot of fun, and I was still debating wether or not I should change my recommendation, but I decided to keep it as Recommended. Hardcore screenlags occurded in maybe 5% of the game, so all in all the experiance was very positive most of the time, and I tried not to forget about that before making hasty change. I am looking forward to your NG project. Please DO work on optimalization this time, the genre has gotten popular and I'm not sure if I buy a game like Die Young after official release not in Early Stage, I won't actually refund it after 90 mintues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029903014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1527634854}
review: Тот случай, когда покупаешь игру исходя из рейтингов и отзывов! Абсолютно не понимаю что так понравилось подавляющему большинству оставивших положительные отзывы.. Выживания там нет, всё выживание сводится к бессистемному убеганию от врагов и запрыгиванию на камушки откуда можно закидать насмерть камнями почти всех. Хоррора нет, это вам не Резидент Ивл, нет, даже не рядом, стелса тоже нет, враги походу спавнятся (по крайней мере собаки) в каких то  нереальных колличествах и почти везде. Куча всякой идиотии типа атакующих без причины орланов и змей ( тут прям повеяло безумием последнего фаркрая) короче сюжета тоже почти нет, крафт убогий, оружия считай отсутствует, оупенворлд - не оупен потому что либо стена из скалы, либо обрыв и море- упадёшь умрешь, и вообще рельеф такой что в итоге корридор какой то.. Игра плохая, и не про выживание совсем, она наверное про прыжки, но и здесь шляпа, то и дело сталкиваешься с ситуациями, когда  не понятно куда прыгать дальше и ты прыгаешь в единственном возможном направлении и разбиваешься нахрен, а система сейвов здесь така я же хорошая как и всё остальное... В общем давно такой херни не видал и чтоб так всем заходило.. Может дело в том что она вроде как про паркур? но его ж там нет! да и кому это вообще интересно??..

author: {'steamid': '76561198040892359', 'num_games_owned': 3008, 'num_reviews': 369, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1538982485}
review:
[h1]Update 10/9/2018[/h1]

There's been an update or two so I thought I'd load up the game again to see if anything has changed... or if it had gotten any better. I made it about 20 more mins.

The graphics look a bit better, I'll say that. Everything else is just as bad though. The menus are a mess, parkour mechanic is still janky as hell, keybinds are such that my hand feels like it's playing Twister on the keyboard.

Well, I only found one dog this time. But a ton of OP mutant rats. Oh, and I found whoever or whatever that butcher guy is. Came runnin' up on me like a freight train.

And that opening cutscene... still so shitty. The whole cutscene she is talking in the past tense, but there's one part where she's snorting coke or kissing a girl or something... that's the only part she slips into present tense. She says "...I experience..." Given the way it's written, she should be saying "experienced." I dunno why, but that just bugged me. Probably because that cutscene made me feel like I just looked into the Lost Ark once it was opened.

Oh, and I like the song on the main menu sceen. I know it's some southern-fried buttrock or something that doesn't seem to fit with the game at all, but it's a catchy tune anyway.

Still in no way recommend. Don't waste money on this gaming abortion.

[b]Original Review[/b]

I know my playtime isn't very high, but trust me, it took only 15 mins to know this game is complete shit. Unless running from dogs is your thing. That's what I spent most of my short playtime doing. That and watching that cringingly bad opening cutscene. The movement reminds me of an even jankier Mirror's Edge (the original, not Catalyst.)

Granted, it does seem it be updated regularly, but if the type of game it is currently is what they're going for, I don't hold out much hope.

Hard pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077474876', 'num_games_owned': 50, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3920, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 918, 'last_played': 1568671737}
review:
**This review  is tailored for other gamers that dont usually buy games for whatever reason, and/or are picky about games**
    I played this game since the beginning of when it was in Early Access a couple years ago, and it is an excellent example of how an EA game should be made. Throughout development they maintained their vision of the game while still getting and listening to feedback on the variables. 
     With release came the full reveal of the map and plot(only about half was released until then), and having played through every bit of it, every side mission, I can simply say it's an amazing and genuinely unique game. 
Heres the breakdown:
Plot: Unique plot unlike any other you see in any genre of games.  It's grounded in reality with situations that could potentially happen, given how human nature can be. No character is perfect, and thats by design. Of all the choices they make none are telegraphed as good or bad, leaving the player to use their own moral compass in deciding that. At times you find yourself empathizing for the enemy, and even sympathizing for some of them a bit(well, I did). It does have a bunch of side missions but none of it feels like filler, and they arent just standard fetch quests or normal quests like that. The Ending is satisfying(there's more than one, all are good and fitting for your choices)
Gameplay: Dont let the videos fool you, This game is not a survival game in the normal sense of the word. You are surviving but youre not managing resources too much or building anything.  You craft weapons, tools, ammo, upgrades to your backpack, health items, etc. You have a food/water meter but its rarely a factor(and thats a good thing, to me. I hate having to manage my own hunger and some virtual persons too lol) It is not an action game outright either. You do kick some ass and take some names but you could go without it through almost the entire game, if not all of it, if youre sneaky enough.So you decide if it's an action or stealth or survival horror-like game by how you play games. More than action, this game is about exploration and surviving nature, the environment, and the human condition(of others, not yourself). There is a lot of parkour and climbing, A LOT. I Would say it's like mirrors edge in that way but its not, it is it's own beast in that department. All of the systems feel tight and well made, and the UI and game content give you just enough to get you from point A to B but without spoon feeding you, and the plot moves along with it constantly so youre never bored. This is a game I accidentally marathon through for hours because I am always wanting to just see that little bit more.  haha Gameplay 10/10
Graphics: Looks great. Indie Gala really outdid themselves with the level design and look of the game that is uniquely Die Young. It doesnt borrow anything visually from anyone, which is nice. It looks like a AAA game made in 2019. 10/10 
Audio: Sound effects are great, the music fits the game, The voice acting is solid, especially for the main antagonist whom you meet about halfway through. Daphne(main character) has solid voice acting. I prefer the old voice actor but I dont dislike the final one.  when you fall, the bone crunch sound is enough to get to you a little bit lol. The audio for enemy footsteps and said is well done. 10/10
Playabillity: It has multiple endings, and a lot to miss in the first playthrough so you can get a solid 2-3 playthroughs out of it as an average gamer. my first playthrough took about 20 hours. Now, I could maybe speed run through the game in 4 hours tops.  For the average person I would say the replay value exceeds the price. 10/10
The abstract: 
-I miss some of the things being a bit more difficult but there is a harder difficulty coming post-release. 
-Make sure to rest at the travel points for extra plot moments.
-Explore, its worth it. 
-Some of the enemy voiceovers are a bit vulgar and repetitive but don't let it dissuade you.(plus theres a reason they are like that)
-It comes with an added game: The Prologue. It is great for background about the setting and the people who inhabit the island. I would play it AFTER the main game though
-Save OFTEN! If you're about to make a risky jump then save! You will die a good amount. Save the frustration. lol

Should you buy it? from a super frugal person, I dont get games a lot. Ill try them out but buying a game, its gotta really be good to be a buy. This is one of them. I think its price is at a justifiable amount even not on sale. Its highlights and parts that make up what id pay for mostly are the gameplay in general and the plot, so the 2 most important parts(in my opinion). Die Young wont change the industry or revolutionize gaming but it is a very strong game that does it's own thing in it's own way. It is everything a game should be, in a time where sadly that is rare. It knows what it is and wanted to be and does that well.
Overall score: 10/10

If you buy any game in 2019, buy this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970469066', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3909, 'last_played': 1603509535}

author: {'steamid': '76561198077986182', 'num_games_owned': 3569, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1526076941}
review:
Where to start?  Firstly.  The graphics are lovely and wonderful.  The game is instantly gripping and immersive... until the HUD/Menus/Inventory/etc. All seem to be extremely noisy and unclean.
Okay, fine.  Not an issue, can be improved...but not an overall problem.  Does not hinder the game in the slightest.

Oooh, climbing parkour?  First lot seems clean.  Smooth, and very well done.
The first time.
After that.  Oh goodness me.  The parkour is just "iffy".  It doesn't always work, even on a perfect jump your character can die from landing perfectly, or fail to grab a ledge entirely when absailing or jumping to ledges EVEN WHEN THE RETICLE INDICATES YOU'RE AIMING AT THE RIGHT SPOT.

After several hours trying to traverse a single area, that is parkour intense...  I threw my dummy out of my pram and just can't stand to play this game anymore.  It's not hard, it's simply terribly implemented.

I had minor issues in the first few locations - beach house, farmhouse, lighthouse, etc.  But the further you get into the game the more complex they try to make it and the more issues that arise.

And this makes the optimiztion, and constant stuttering, even more prevelant because they highlight and worsen each other.  I turned down all settings to as bare minimum as I could get them and it didn't change a single thing, the game stutters continuously.  I've played Arkham Knight, I played 55hrs through that monstrosity but I couldn't handle 5hrs in this.

I'm still fuming from the eye balls because I'm invested in this game, it's genuinely not worth the frustration to see it through though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065390183', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1575062538}
review: This isn't so much a review as it is an update on my thoughts of the game as it currently stands, and on my thoughts on its development over all.  Many months ago, when I first started taking an interest in early access games, this was one of the top rated ones on my recommendations.  From what little I've played of the game(tbh I haven't really played it months, but do keep up with all the updates) I can say I absolutely love this game.  From a small studio this is something truly astounding.  It might just be my bias towards games with a setting and feel such as this, i.e. the new tomb raider reboot and the various horror survival games that have come about within the last decade.   From the basics of storytelling, to the sense of freedom, and dread, that exploration on the island brings, combined with an organic feeling combat and crafting system, this game is, in my mind, set to a hidden gem amongst gamers.  The fact that the developers are taking the time to fix things that not only their testers find lack luster or just done poorly, but they are fixing and changing things to fit the vision that they have set out for themselves.  They don't set a release window, rather they simply have faith in the community that they have built to wait unitl it's finished.  When it's done it's done the saying goes.  And this game couldn't be more true.  With a lot of recent blunders in games, both from triple a titles and other indie titles, due to development time tables and strict resource allocation, it is wonderful to be part of a game that is being made to be the best that it can be, not to hit a magical number neeeded for quarterly profits.  I greatly look forward to the completion of this games, but also dread the end of its development.  Luckily though, the final product may yet be a ways off, but I'm perfectly happy waiting.  Perfection may never be achieved, but at the end of the day the developers get to realease something that they put their hopes and dreams, their hearts and souls into, and that's what makes it so special.  So to the developers I say this:  Take all the time you need.  Never compromise.  Gaming is an art form, not just an avenue for entertainment and profits.  Keep making games for the sake of making games, and everything else will take care of itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046440800', 'num_games_owned': 1415, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1584374149}
review:
Not sure can you finish the game currently but i got as far as i could so i might change this review a little after it releases or throughout the development.

Pros:
-HARDCORE PARKOUR
-Easy crafting system
-Big map to explore
-Quests to find and do
-GOATS
-Fast travel

Cons:
-Super weak to falling even with the item.
-Quests do not have almost any help indication
-Performance problems
-Mostly dogs as enemies.
-Only 3 weapons
-Ledge jumping can sometimes come with weird side effects

Overall:
For an early access title, it was alot of fun to play. Finding all those hidden gear was pretty nice for explorer like me. Big map to explore, visuals look nice and many areas to find. If you like parkour/adventure type game, this is for you. Will play when releases 100%. English is not my main language so sorry for any typos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198370635727', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1527, 'last_played': 1518640786}
review: 首先这游戏有汉化这一点非常不错，然后跑酷类型也是我喜欢的，新人前期千万别被蛇咬了，别被咬了，别被咬了。虽然没有开发完毕我已经收集到能收集的东西了，两个屠夫也被我用6只针筒毒死了，最后的BOSS狗也被我读档9次靠技巧用电网搞死了，打死了抱歉我用了修改器修改了背包容量，因为容量真的太少了，我修改到了99的容量，打完BOSS之后坐电梯到了山下做完支线任务后绕着地图跑了一圈后就没有再玩了等更新，总体来说这个游戏是不错的助跑跳崖的时候真的会卡一下然后掉下去死了，还好我背包容量大，还有一点告诉新人，就是制作的火堆可以然你随时存档遇到较宽的悬崖时存一个吧，不然回到上一个存档点真的很心酸。

author: {'steamid': '76561198311687966', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1572969673}
review:
CHINA ！中文！！！清楚第三人称视角！这样玩的人会更多更庞大的！OK?
游戏超级好玩，但是就是操作太难受，这游戏最重要的是跳跃，需要助跑，但是助跑总是随机的延迟，这样你就会在无数次的从悬崖上掉下来，心态简直崩溃，因为必须助跑才能跳过去，但是助跑总有迟钝，你要我怎么玩这游戏？而且存储点超级远，简直能磨碎你的心！反正我是服了！搁置在哪里了！受不了了！崩溃！

author: {'steamid': '76561198134086602', 'num_games_owned': 995, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1522613886}
review:
Nunca había oído sobre "Die Young", pero ahora que lo he probado me tiene intrigado!
Les dejo un video con un primer vistazo del juego:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K15ms8wbd-s

Apenas llevo unas 2 horas del juego, y me pareció muy interesante la premisa. Me hizo acordar un poco al inicio de Farcry 3, ya que aparecemos en una isla donde nos habrían secuestrado? y la que tendremos que investigar y por sobre todo, tratar de escapar. Tiene incorporado un sistema de crafting orientado a la supervivencia básica, y el movimiento de la protagonista, en primera persona, me pareció bastante inspirado en Mirror´s Edge, con algunos elementos de parkour.
Gráficamente es espectacular y todo esto en base a la versión alpha, habrá que esperar a que salga la versión final para descubrir todo lo que nos tienen preparado los desarrolladores.

review:
Graphics quality: like first of Far Cry, with a lot of quality problems.
World design: some elements looks good, but in common world looks poor. A lot of badly designed locations, like buildings. Abandoned buildings in Half-Life 2 were designed much better 15 years ago.
Gameplay: several elements from Stalker, crafting in Far Cry 3 style. Good choice.
Story: it could be better. Game have a lot of problems with logic (like hungry dog in a room with dead body).

author: {'steamid': '76561198007268696', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1567707897}
review:
A nice indie game that leads your thoughts unto a cross over of The Forest and Dying Light.
It is a survival game, combined with some crafting and a bit of suspense/horror.

The gameplay is pretty good, the parkour elements works pretty well and the graphics are not over the top, but it is pretty for a small game. 

It took me a little while to get the hang of the controls, the surroundings in the game and the crafting, but once you get get caught in the spooky story, then it slowly gets under your skin.

This game is for players, who likes an open world game, where you fight for your survival and where you need to think fast to live through the obstacles!

I have played this game for 5 hours now, and I think I have a decent amount of exploring yet, to finish this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197966527290', 'num_games_owned': 3794, 'num_reviews': 473, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1522328503}

review: 90% of this game is running from dogs. Get shot by arrows? Cut with a battle axe? Mauled by dogs? You'll be fine but you will die from one tiny fall. The AI is also incredibly dumb. I ran into an enemy who had a crossbow, I killed him with a wrench. I could not pick up and use his crossbow, he also had a holster (quiver) with so many arrows. I know the game is about avoiding enemies but the game is also about SURVIVAL. The main character can craft weapons but cannot pick up a crossbow and learn how to use it? I'm sorry but that's just horribly illogical.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007845812', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 6185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4493, 'last_played': 1678766471}
review:
If you are coming to this game looking for a survival experience, and are not a fan of platforming games, stay clear of this product. If you're a fan of parkour games, this is definitely an interesting twist!

I just want to start by saying this game looks amazing. I don't have the best graphics card on the market, but even running on med at 75% render scale I feel like I am on a beautiful remote island as I lose myself in the game. I bought this game the week it released, and ended up returning it because I felt like it was too early for it to be released for money. Albeit they were clearly looking for funding, where as I was looking for something to play. I bought the game a few months later and played it a nice bit.

From what I recall of the update at the time the game was (for an alpha product) very well polished. I didn't have many issues with the climbing mechanics (besides the super human distances this woman can jump along a cliff edge) and the few I did just made the game more fun. I never got to the end of the content at the time, and this was before the tower update. I re-downloaded the game the other day seeing all the new updates and content, but I have to say I feel the gameplay itself has gotten worse. I am not sure if the climbing system is broken in the current update, or if it has always been this way and the early stage of the game just holds your hand to the point where it's not noticable, but where I am at the moment is driving me insane.

*** Edit ***
It was that update.

The point I am at is actually slightly depicted in one of the preview videos, the labled climbing wall. I just got to the top, figured out which way to go (although I was certain the jump would kill me, and it did a few times I almost didn't try it again), and all of a sudden the jumps are so far apart and the characters ability to grab a ledge is so aweful. As determined as I am after coming this far to finally get to whatever this tower is I am starting to think I am about to uninstall this game and return after more updates.

*** Edit ***
I have been playing this game again more recently (Nov, 2018) and these mechanics have become MUCH better! I was tempted to just delete this review entirely and start over but I put so much heart into this, and the beginning couple paragraphs are still accurate so I figured I would just drop in another edit. I actually did get to the end of the content after writting this, and have beaten it multiple times since I have redownloaded it. At the beginning of the review it sort of sounds like I discredit the survival mechanics because it is a parkour-heavy game. In reality I feel like that makes it a much more enjoyable experience!  The next few paragraphs can be ignored, so if you've made it this far thank you for taking the time to read my review!

I am slowly slinking my way up this mountain pass, dying over and over doing what appear to be easy, obvious jumps because the distance at which I am expected to jump gives milisecond windows. Either I jump too early and even though the character collider is clearly touching the ledge she doesn't grab, or I jump too late and the character slides off the ledge I am trying to jump from. I really want to get to the end of the content, I REALLY do. But I am sitting here busting veins in my eyes because the character is quite clearly touching the ledge and just wont grab hold.

Considering the time it would take someone attacking this game blind to get to where I am, especially if they are a casual gamer, only to be thrown into these jumps that break the seems of the mechanics, I cannot recommend this game until it has seen more updates. I held off on writing a review before as I didn't feel like I had played enough, and I wish I played more so I knew if this is just a problem with the current update.

Either way, unless you are interested in playing a survival/escape game, only to get thrown into a hard core, casual destroying platformer right around the point of no return, stay clear from this one for now.

*** Edit *** 
I have changed this to a recommendation because I do actually really love this game. My above still stands, if you are looking for a survival/escape game and have no interest in parkour games, this is porbably not for you. I however do like parkour games, and for anyone else who does this game does give an awesome experience.
developer_response:
Hi DeepFriedOreo!
Thanks for your feedback.
What you described (character not grabbing holds) looks like a bug we had few months ago, but that should be fixed in the current version (0.5.0.340.18).
What version are you playing?
Could you provide us a video showing the issue?
Also, saved games could be helpful. You can find them in this folder:
C:\Users\[UserName]\AppData\Local\DieYoung\Saved\SaveGames
(you may need to show hidden items)

Please, send them at dieyoungnow@indiegala.com

Thank you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014951585', 'num_games_owned': 378, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 967, 'last_played': 1597581587}
review:
After finishing the first trial (I took around 9 hours to get there) these are my most succinct thoughts on the current state of gameplay  - I can recommend it as it is sufficiently fun, sometimes scary, sometimes gorgeous and sometimes puzzling in a fun way. 

However… It is also a great game only in potential as it is marred by too much of one thing. There is an almost unbelievable amount of parkour and climbing necessary to finish the first trial and I am really not looking forward to another two trials of similar length, difficulty and sheer tediousness.  

The voice acting is maybe not the worst I’ve heard, but it is certainly the worst I’ve heard in a long, long time. 

The save system is too punishing for the last part of the first trial. It works well most of the time, but after falling 12 times and having to repeat a tedious climb it really starts to kill the mood and test the nerves.

All of the abovementioned issues might and likely will get fixed by the time the game is finished, but there is one thing though that I doubt they can fix…the overarching story.

An absolute turn-off is the incredibly pretentious, tendentious and ridiculously unbelievable story and writing. I won’t spoil anything here, but by the time it was revealed to me what the game was about I wanted to burn the entire island, jump off the cliff I just spent hours climbing and drill into the moronic graffiti proclaiming ideas only a 16-yeard old social theory enthusiast could write in a public toilet of a 1st world country after a night of binge drinking. The only way the premise laid out by the game’s creators could possibly be “fixed” is if it is eventually revealed that a feeble-minded child is pulling the strings behind the island’s bedlam. I mean this is Kojima level of bad writing. All that is missing is intro credits before every trial saying developers’ names 11 times.

But go play it - it really is fun if the story is ignored and you are a gamer that doesn’t give up easily.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035414414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1518800215}
review: I usually like survilval horror games. This one starts well, good story, nice scenery, atmosphere, until... you understand it's a PLATFORM!!! And I hate platforms. At first you can't explore much, fighting is though, but that's not a big problem. Problem starts when you find out that to find useful stuff that can help you get through it you must jump-jump-jumpjumpjump... like a rabbit. And that's where you get the thumb down. Played it for six hours most of them spent trying and trying to make the right jump. Enough. Never again. Platforms aren't my piece of cake. Gave up that crap years ago, in secondary school. That's really a pity. It could have been a really good game. But not this way. This is just boring.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964149687', 'num_games_owned': 749, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 611, 'last_played': 1518382531}
review:
[h1]Summary:[/h1]

Die Young is a compelling survival title which offers a mix of parkour and stealh within an open-world setting.  Discovering yourself captured and alone, you must now work to understand the mysteries of your abduction, and escape to stay alive.  It unfortunately struggles with providing the player an introduction into the game's mechanics, so it will require some dedication the first hour or so to have the most enjoyment.  Once you understand inventory management, crafting and get a sense of where you are going and how to go about it, things will finally [b][i]click[/i][/b], and you will ready to start appreciating the game.  This is unfortunate; I see several reviews where they had played just around an hour and wrote negatively; I had a tough time at first as well.  Once you have pushed through, it is a really fun experience that pulls you in.  Providing a beautiful backdrop on an island in the Mediterranean has made me take screenshots often.  The game is in alpha and has it's familiar share of flaws, but if you want to check things out before there is a final product, you can definitely dig right in.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]

[list][*]I'm starting to realize that I might just be a sucker for Unreal Engine 4 (which the game uses), but the game really is beautiful, and it is exciting to see how high of quality you can get with indie titles these days.  You will really appreciate this game if you are the type of person that likes to wander and discover, and if you are like me you'll stop to [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1297704572]take pictures[/url].  The illustrations I feel like could be slightly more polished themselves ([i]but[/i] are still mood appropriate), however the in-game graphics are [b]more[/b] than you might expect.  Subtle touches like a keybind that allows you to look behind you, in [i]slow motion[/i] when you are running, adds to the suspense of the moment.  The quick fluctations between peaceful to freightening sceneries gives you a great eerie sense of what is safe, and what is dangerous.

[*]The mechanics can take a little bit to warm up to [i](example; when jumping between ledges, the crosshair will  have a box form around it)[/i], but once you have the movement down in Die Young it feels natural and rewarding.  There will be times where you'll find that you will end up falling and taking damage if you lose your momentum, which really shows that there was some thought put into the the general fluidity.  Unfortunately until you get the hang of it, this might be mistaken instead for being clumsy...so take the time to play around a little bit before you write it off.  If I had to draw a parallel here, ultimately the movement feels the most like Dying Light.  That almost isn't reasonable to say though since this game has an emphasis on jumping puzzles, and the stealth elements are inherent.  The game's ability to mix your activities between sneaking, jumping and fighting provides a forward motion that will keep you interested.

[*]And while I have noted that for new players there can be difficulty to adapt to the gameplay initially, the depth you will find is surprising and welcome.  The crafting system will allow you to adapt to your needs by crafting weapons, tools and healing items to continue your journey.  You will learn that there is a day/night cycle; you may take naps to restore yourself, and must seek cover at night.  There are six equipment slots to equip to your body which will further increase your chances of survival; heck, there is even a fast travel system.  While the game could be more linear to get things started, the amount it allows you to discover on your own does make you celebrate all the more as you make progress.[/list]


[h1]Cons:[/h1]

[list][*]It took me a while to consider what I would say the [i]worst[/i] con for the game was, but after consideration I have to go with the audio in general.  During your playtime you will hear everything from moody rock music, all the way to synth wave which creates for a jarring experience.  This combined with some songs that have vocals that really detract from any cohesiveness you might have had, especially if the game is going for a semi-horror aspect.  There is definitely originality and a vision with the music, but ultimately outside of cutscenes and menus I would shy away from the rock songs and go for songs that will increase the suspense.  The sound effects in some areas such as water dripping could even be redone a bit, and I'd say the voice acting is on the scale of mediocre.  This is by no stretch a dealbreaker, but if these areas were to be improved would make the title that much more provocative.

[*]As I had discussed during the summary, The beginning portions of the game are unintuitive and just downright confusing.  You will begin inside of what looks like a well, when a mysterious stranger drops a crudely drawn map for you.  A quest tracker will appear with often less than useful information, and...that is about it.  It is clear where you should head first, but when discussing the inventory or crafting, you may be left with a degree of uncertainty and needed experimentation.  You will start with no equipment items at all and a very limited inventory space.  I honestly didn't even realize there was opportunity for growing the inventory with a backpack until much later on, and it was a rather frustrating prospect for me.  Here is a suggestion; when leaving the well at the very start, you ascend into a gated courtyard with some herbs and a tutorial on crafting.  After opening the gate a sequence starts where you are chased by a dog which again provides a tutorial and an additional parkour sequence to warm the player up and start them in the direction of a water source.  These small changes would probably draw people into the game a [b]lot[/b] sooner.

[*]The game pulls elements from a few very well known games, and I think sometimes forgets it's own originality as a result.  The story premise to the game is pretty much Farcry 3; adventurous 20 somethings, off on an island journey that leads to their abduction.  The jump and parkour mechanics can feel very similar to Dying Light, Mirror's Edge and Tomb Raider (you even save your game at a campfire).  Despite this, the game starts to show superior level design as you make it to the Manor and toward the mountainous areas. The crafting and quick travel options you will find later on in your search are some of the first moments you will really start to see and understand the depth of the game.  As I have said before the game really takes some time to pull you in, yet I am still glad that I continued forward.[/list]

[h1]Conclusion:[/h1]

At first blush I was worried, but once I cut my teeth into Die Young, it provides for a surprisingly solid movement system and deep game.  For new players, I would suggest either watching or reading a beginner tutorial before you get started.  Investing a bit of time to learn what you are doing will make everything worth your time.  And even with bugs and being in an alpha state, if anything I've said sounds like a game you'd be interested in buying...$15 really isn't a bad deal.  The game is not [i]quite[/i] as suspensful as I initally thought, but you realize that really isn't the true essence of the game, and rather just creates a tone of survival which is needed.  Done in the beautiful UE4 engine, I would say Die Young is worth checking out before full release.  This isn't genre defining, but it brings a great experience.




[i]If you liked this review or want to see more recommended games, be sure to follow our curator group: [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Original_Curators_Group#curation]Follow Original Curator Group[/url]
